Initially, she made her living making cigarettes, an activity she learned 20 years ago with her family.  Today, she buys uncut tobacco, prepares it, and promotes and sells it in stores.  A year ago, she began selling beer and other refreshments to significantly increase her income.  She later also added assorted merchandise, in particular women's clothing, which she sells on credit and recovers her investment monthly.

Her goal is to expand her business in order to make renovations that will improve the conditions of her housing.  Josefa works very hard so that this will happen, but her working capital is not suffient to respond to market demands.  This is why she is turning to a Kiva loan, her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy:  beer in bulk and women's clothing that has been pre-ordered.  With these products, her customers will enjoy the Christmas holidays and the new year, elegant, dancing and drinking a little.

loans.use: to buy beer in bulk and women's clothing.

loans.name: Hector Amilkar

texts.es:
Héctor con 33  años de edad, originario de Managua, casado, con conocimiento académico universitario, padre de 2 hijos entre las edades de 2 y  5 años respectivamente, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de venta de repuesto de vehículo y vulcanización. Inicio hace 12 años en el ámbito del comercio,  vendiendo lubricantes pero este negocio no le resulto muy rentable porque no le generaba mucho ingreso, fue allí que  decidió establecer otro negocio como es el de reparación y alineación  de llantas, ya que miro que  el lugar era accesible para este negocio el cual le generaba mejores ganancias, este ha sido su primer  negocio, el cuenta con la ayuda de su hermano quien trabaja con el.
El esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar  batería, aceites para carro, llantas, etc. Toda la materia prima que necesita para su taller. Ya que el estima que este crédito le ayudaría a comprar más activo fijo  como vitrina, herramientas nuevas y otra variedad de productos que aun no tiene en inventario y de esta manera poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, sus planes futuro es comprar otro terreno para ampliar y poner otro negocio de todo tipo de repuesto, su  meta próxima es poder cambiar las maquinarias de reparación de vehículo que tiene con unas nuevas, y mejorar la infraestructura del local para darle una mejor presentación al local.
texts.en:
Héctor, age 33, is originally from Managua. He is married and has a university education. Héctor is the father of two children, ages 2 and 5 respectively. He is a merchant and has a business where he sells vehicle spare parts and provides tire repair services. Héctor started 12 years ago selling lubricants, but this business was not profitable since he was not able to generate much income. He then started another business repairing and aligning tires. Héctor looked for a place that was available for establishing this business, but he ended up at the location that was used for his first business. His brother helps him with the work.

Héctor is requesting a loan so that he can buy batteries, motor oil, tires, and other products. All of these items are needed in his workshop. He believes the loan will also help him acquire more fixed assets such as a display cabinet, new tools, and a variety of other products that he currently does not have in stock. As a result, he will be able to satisfy the needs of his customers.

Héctor’s future plans include buying another plot of land so that he can expand and open another business that involves selling all types of spare parts. The next items on his priority list include replacing the machinery used for vehicle repairs and improving the infrastructure of his shop so that it will have a better appearance.

loans.use: to buy batteries, motor oil, tires, and other products.

loans.name: Anifa

texts.en: Anifa is a thirty three year old married woman living in Bundibugyo,Uganda. She has a cocoa business and a side income from selling spare parts. She has been in business for over 10 years. She started the business in order to afford an education for her children since her husband was not able to earn enough to meet the ever increasing fees. Anifa is a very hardworking client whose dream is to become the leading cocoa producer in the region despite the challenges of having inadequate capital to buy more land for farming. Sometimes she has to buy from other farmers and this limits her profits. She intends to use the loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija is a 42 year old married woman with three children living in Bundibugyo,Uganda. She trades in food products and with the proceeds she has been able to pay school fees for her children. She started the business so as to meet the daily expenses since farming is very seasonal. Inadequate capital and exploitation by middle men are her great challenges. Her dream is to own a food store since the business is very lucrative. Hadija intends to use the loan to buy food products such as cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy food products such as cassava flour to sell

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a 62 year old woman with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She started her business of selling food 30 years and with the proceeds she was able to buy land and pay school fees for her children. Price fluctuation and the unpredictable weather changes pose a challenge to her growth. Her business plan is to set up food stores in at least three towns. Faith intends to use the loan to buy food such as beans and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy food such as beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Ms. Musarat is a 48-year-old married lady. She is successfully doing a business of hand embroidery. She is a very talented and hardworking lady. She has gained years of experience in this field and has gradually improved her standard of living through her business. Her daughter also assists her in completing customers’ orders on time. Musarat makes enough to lead a decent life. 

In order to meet the requirements of her customers, Musarat needs to purchase raw material. She contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 15,000. 

In this way, she would be able to purchase more spools of thread with packs of sequins, pearls and stones in various colors. This would help her to complete the demands of her customers time after time, which will ultimately help in generating more cash. She dreams of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread with packs of sequins, pearls and stones in various colors.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Ms. Yasmeen is a 41-year-old married woman. She has two children, both of whom are school going. Her husband deals in a hawker’s business. When she realized that her husband's income was not sufficient to meet all the household expenditures with ease, she and her husband took the initiative of starting a goat selling business. 

Presently, she has four goats and plans to purchase two more goats to earn more profit. For this purpose, she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She has a strong association with Kashf, as she has availed herself of loans five times and always paid back her installments on time. 

Her dream is to save enough of money for the marriage of her daughter. She is putting away savings on a daily basis to make it possible.

loans.use: to purchase two goats

loans.name: Shaista

texts.en: Shaista is a 23-year-old woman. She is efficiently running a beauty parlor in her community. Her husband is a rickshaw driver but his income is insufficient to meet the basic needs of their family. Due to this reason, she started her own beauty salon to contribute to the family income to support the needs of her family members. She has two children. She is working hard to provide them with quality food, health and education. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. It’s her 3rd year with Kashf Foundation. Currently she requested a loan of 30000 PKR to purchase more packs of makeup kits, cleansing products and lipstick. This will help her to cater to more customers time after time. She dreams of providing her children with a good quality education.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of makeup kits, cleansing products and lipstick.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Ms. Sakina is 42 years old and married. She has three children, two daughters and one son. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant. His income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. She started her business to contribute to the family income.

She has been in the business of sewing for many years. She is very familiar with the stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. She requested a loan of Rs 20000 to buy a stock of threads of different colors, buttons, needles, etc. so that she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads of different colors, buttons, needles, etc.

loans.name: Emprendiendo Hacia El Éxito Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos!, Este es el grupo “Emprendiendo hacia el Éxito” conformado por 8 socias caracterizadas por ser muy alegres y luchadoras. La Srta. Susan es socia del grupo, tiene 24 años, soltera y sobre todo muy trabajadora. Ella tiene un negocio de artículos de Ferretería, el cual le genera gran parte de sus ingresos y conjuntamente ofrece sus servicios como docente en un colegio allegado a su casa. El presente préstamo es para la obtención de mercaderías para su negocio de Ferretería y así poder abastecer a toda su clientela. Ella junto a las demás integrantes del grupo agradecen a todas aquellas personas que pudieron ayudarlas mediante KIVA y EDAPROSPO.

La Srta. Susan viste una casaca de color negra y es la primera en la parte de la derecha de la foto.
texts.en:
Greetings from the ‘Emprendiendo hacia el Éxito’ Group! The group has eight members who are known for their cheerfulness and hard work. 

Señorita Susan is one of the members. She is 24 years old, single, and more than anything else, very hardworking. She runs a hardware store which provides the majority of her income. However, she is also a teacher at a school near to her house.

The current loan will be used to buy stock for her hardware business so she is able to offer a wide range of merchandise to all her customers. 

Along with the other group members, Susan wishes to thank those people in Kiva and EDAPROSPO who provide help for her group.

In the photograph Susan is first on the right wearing a black jacket.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her hardware business

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a 56-year-old widowed lady who supports three children between the ages of 15 and 28. She practices horticulture on her farm, which has been in operation for a period of one year and earns an income of KES 15,000.

Paulina is servicing her fourth loan of KES 22,000 from KADET LTD after she repaid the previous one successfully. She intends to use this amount to till more land and purchase passion seedlings. The profits she gets will be used to pay school fees for her children and repay the loan. She hopes to expand her passion fruit farm.

loans.use: To purchase passion fruit seedlings and tilling

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Ms. Naseem is a 37-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last 10 years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 

Naseem is a mother of six children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy a stock of rice and flour from the market at lower price and to expand her business. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown excellent credit history. She wishes to spend part of her earnings to deal with the expenses of her children’s education and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice and flour from the market

loans.name: Shafiqan

texts.en: Ms. Shafiqan is a 37-year-old married woman. She is a devoted person and efficiently runs a business of vegetable sales with her husband. The man shown in the photo is Shafiqan’s husband. She makes enough money to support her family. She is liable to bear their cost of education, food, and clothing. She needs to expand her business, so she contacted Kashf Foundation and requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase a stock of fresh vegetables including onions, potatoes and tomatoes. Having these vegetables would attract more people to her shop and would earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fresh vegetables such as onions, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 55-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running an embroidery business in her community for the last four years. Her husband works as a clerk but earns insufficient income to support his family alone. Razia’s embroidery designs and patterns are much in demand. She is motivated to provide for her family and wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy spools of thread with packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material in large quantities to meet the increasing demand of her customers. She has been in association with Kashf for five years. She wishes to spend part of the revenues to deal with the expenses of her family members.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread with packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material in large quantities to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar is a 27-year-old widow. She is an active and talented lady who excels in the work of stitching. She has gained years of experience in this field and has gotten a lot of appreciation from the people of her community. She didn’t lose hope after the death of her husband and continued her stitching work to support the needs of her two children. For meeting the requirements of her customers she needs to purchase more spools of thread and packs of lace, buttons and needles. She applied for a loan of PKR 30000 to Kashf Foundation. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and is very much thankful to Kashf for its support. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread and packs of lace, buttons and needles.

loans.name: Imeda

texts.en:
Imeda, 37 years old, is from Gardabani district. Imeda requested a loan from the local financial institutions several times to start a family business, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for Imeda is working as a guard in a private company. It is hardly enough for food. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Imeda requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the loan, Imeda will purchase sheep. After purchasing the sheep, he plans to expand the number of livestock and increase his income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions for Imeda.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 49-year-old farmer who lives in Nkubu county, Kenya with his wife and three children. Two of the children are still in school. Peter has been in farming for the past eleven years producing coffee, bananas and other fruits, and vegetables, which he sells at his local market.

Peter is requesting a KES75,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase water tanks for irrigation, which will help him in grow more produce. This will lift his living standards and he can use some of the money to pay for his children's schooling. He also aspires to have purchased one acre of land in the next five years.

Dry spells, pests and diseases are his major challenges in farming.

Peter says Juhudi Kilimo offers the best services for its clients.

loans.use: To purchase water tanks for irrigation.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 60-year-old businessman. He is married to Josephine, a businesswoman. They are blessed with four children. Francis has been running a retail shop for the past two years, with a monthly income of KES15,000 that he uses to support his family. 

Francis is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a credit officer. Francis will use the loan to buy stock of sugar, rice and maize meal to sell. With the anticipated profit from the business he will expand his shop. 

His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, rice and maize meal to sell.

loans.name: Bebi

texts.en:
Bebi considers herself to be a happy person of good character, friendly, and above all very responsible in her work. She lives with her husband and their four children in the town of Msambweni.

Bebi works in food vending, a business she has done for the last six months. It’s going very well; she is very popular among her customers. In order to improve service to her customers, she needs to invest in the purchase of more ingredients like wheat flour, vegetables and cooking fat, among other essential items. With this loan, she will improve attention to her customers and improve her sales and income.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients like wheat flour, vegetables and cooking fat, among other essential items

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en: Mamuka is 32 years old, married, and lives in Batumi with his wife and three children. The source of the family income is the monthly salary earned by Mamuka’s wife working at a non-governmental organization. Mamuka has requested a loan from the local financial institutions for starting up a business but his loan requests have been rejected several times because he lacks experience with new business start-ups and does not qualify for a traditional loan under income requirements. Mamuka is requesting a loan under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This loan program provides start-up and restart-up loans with reduced requirements for the rural poor who do not have access to many credit products because they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers." Mamuka will use his loan to purchase seine and fishing tackle for starting up a fishing business. He has recently bought the hooks and plans to fish in the Black Sea.  He hopes that his business will be profitable and sell many fish at the local open market. By increasing his monthly income, he hopes that the new business initiative will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase seine and fishing tackle for starting up a fishing business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 52 years old and a business lady. She is married to Paul, a businessman. They are blessed with four children. She has been selling fruits for the past seven years with the monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD  after being introduced by a friend who is a registered client of KADET. Jane will use the loan to purchase more fruits to sell. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a lorry for transporting fruits.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 44 years old and a business lady. She is married to Jeremiah who is a businessman. They are blessed with three children. She has been running a retail shop for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced by a credit officer. Grace will use the loan to buy stock of sugar, rice, and maize meal to sell.  

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will expand her shop. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, maize meal etc

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ms Ishrat is 20 years old and married. She has been running a general store with the support of her husband. Her husband has maintained many relationships in the market for buying goods at wholesale rates. They offer various items of goods for daily use. Ishrat has good communication skills and counts a good client list. They are happily doing this together for the sake of their family members. 

Ishrat is a mother of five children, all going to school. In order to make her store fully stocked, she needs to purchase sacks of rice, flour, and packs of oil. Due to this, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 20000. She has been in association with Kashf for four years. She expects an increase in her net income by catering to more customers time after time. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, flour and  oil.

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en: Ms Nagina is 21 years old. She has been efficiently doing stitching work for the last five years. She is eager to support her family members by contributing to the family income. She knows the techniques of stitchery very well and became popular in her street. For meeting the demands of her customers, she needs to purchase more raw materials. Therefore, she contacted Kashf Foundation for the second time and applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase more spools of threads, buttons, lace and needles. In this way, she would be able to complete orders without delay, which ultimately helps in generating more cash. She wishes to provide a quality education to her siblings.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, buttons, lace and needles.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Ms Kaneez has been doing a stitching business for many years. She initiated her business after separating from her husband in order to bear her own expenses instead of becoming a burden on her family members. She has gained 10 years of experience in this field and has maintained a good client list. She is known for the best stitching in her community. 

She needs to purchase more stitching material for completing orders on time. For this, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000. This will help her to purchase more spools of thread with packs of buttons, lace and zippers in various colors. She has been in association with Kashf for two years. She expects an increase in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, packs of buttons, lace and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a 57-year-old mixed-crop farmer. He is a widower with four children. He has been in the farming business for the past thirteen years and has a monthly income of KES15,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a credit officer. Gabriel will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will pay for his children's education. His hopes and dreams are to venture into a zero-grazing farm business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Otar

texts.en:
Otar is 20 years old from the small village of Martvili district. He lives with his wife and 2 infant children. Otar has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of his ow income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have 2 milk cows and 0.5 hectare agricultural land, where 200 nut trees are grown. They sell the harvested products locally in an open market at a good price. The money earned is barely enough to feed the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Otar has requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products and are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Otar will purchase a car. After purchasing the car, Otar plans to buy groceries in Kutaisi to transport to his village for resale at a  better price. He will be able to increase the income of his family. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-Up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is taking out a new loan to expand her food vending business because demand has risen for the pasr few weeks. She does not want to disappoint her clients, so she wants to make new investments so that she can offer a variety of food in her food stall. Fatuma says that since her previous loans, her income has been gradually increasing hence improving the quality of life for her family. She needs to buy more ingredients which is why she is asking for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as flour, vegetables, meat, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 34 years old  and a mixed crop farmer.  She is married to Francis, a businessman. They are blessed with three children. She has been in the farming business for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 11,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by a credit officer. Faith will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profit from her business, she will educate her children.  

Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses which will increase her monthly income, improving the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en: Sara is a 32-year-old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 15 years. She describes herself to be a visionary woman. She operates a farm where she sells farm produce. She has been involved in this business for 17 years. Her business is located in a very productive area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the poor infrastructure of road network to her business farm. She will use the loan of KES 8,700 to purchase a water tank.  Her business goal is to buy additional land within five years.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 32-year-old businesswoman. She is single but supports her parents. She has been selling charcoal for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to take care of her basic needs. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced by a credit officer. Irene will use the loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will expand the business. Her hope is to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en:
Ephantus is a 28-year-old farmer in Nkubu County in Kenya where he lives with his wife and two children who are both schooling. He has been in farming for over seven years producing eggs and vegetables, which he sells at the market in his local area.

He is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. He will later sell the products and earn extra income to help him boost his livelihood and to pay for his children's schooling. He aspires to be raising more than 1,000 poultry birds in the next five years.

The high cost of feed is his major challenge in farming.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy produce to sell, such as beans and maize.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is a 44-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 12 years to 24 years. She describes herself as creative and a risk taker. 

She operates a farm where she sells farm produce that is produced during the harvesting, such as tomatoes, cabbages, etc. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a productive area and her customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as stiff competition within the area. 

She will use the 8,700 KES loan to purchase a water tank, which will be used by her family members. 

Her business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will increase her farm production .

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Kassimu

texts.en: Kassimu, 45, is married and has four children. He lives in the rural area of Msambweni. He’s worked in agriculture since he was a gentleman and has been growing a variety of crops including corn, bananas, and pawpaw, among others, for about three years now. He sells his products in local markets in the town. He’s currently asking for a KES 50,000 loan to buy fertilizer and manure and pay for labor costs. He hopes to get better crop yields and to prepare the soil better because his plan is that his crops improve each season and produce profits so he can live better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure and pay labor costs

loans.name: Benadette

texts.en:
Benadette is a 35-year-old mixed crop farmer who is married to Joseph, a businessman. They are blessed with three children. She has been in the farming business for 11 years and makes a monthly income of KES 12,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her third loan term with KADET LTD after repaying her previous loans on time. Benadette will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she plans to buy a dairy cow.  Her hopes are to own a big tea farm, which will improve the living standards of her fa

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Immaculle

texts.en:
Immaculle is 52 years old. She is married with four children. The oldest is 25 years old and youngest is 17. 

She has been in business for 12 years and she needs a loan to buy more sorghum for making traditional drinks. 

With the profits, she will pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to make more traditional soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie is 48 years old. She is a widow with three children. The oldest is 19 years old, and the youngest is six years old. Eugenie has been in business for one year. She wants a loan to buy more sorghum to sell. The profit will pay for school fees and help her take care of her house.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en: Veneranda is married with seven children. The oldest is 27 years old, and the youngest is seven years old. She has been in business for two years. She wants a loan to buy more salt, sugar, cooking oil and soap. The profit will assist her to further expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores de 61 años de edad, casada  con cuatro hijos mayores de edad. Ella es originaria de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, Dolores es persona que se destaca por su amabilidad, responsabilidad, tenacidad de trabajo. Y gracias a su espíritu de perseverancia  tiene por actividad económica venta de leña, nacatamales (comida típica de la región) y fresco.  En un lugar establecido en su comunidad, desde hace 15 años que desempeña la actividad que hasta la fecha ha sido su medio de vida, y su forma de obtener ingresos. La rutina diaria de dolores es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias elaborando y vendiendo sus diferentes productos como nacatamales, frescos naturales. Ya ha trabajado con fundación y ha demostrado su puntualidad en los pagos en tiempo y forma. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar materia prima para la elaboración del nacatamal como cerdos, condimentos, hojas de nacatamal, leña, gas,papas, arroz y frutas como pina, bananos, sandias, naranjas, cálalas. Dolores agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Dolores is 61 years old, married, and has four adult children.  She is from Malpaisillo, a place located in the western zone of the country.  Dolores is a person known for her friendliness, responsibility, and dedication to her work and to her perseverance in her sales of firewood, nacatamales (typical food of the region) and fresh drinks.  She works in an establishment she set up in her community 15 years ago and up to now this has been her way of making a living.

Her daily routine is to work 10 hours daily making and selling her different products like nacatamales, and natural drinks.  She has worked with the foundation before and has a demonstrated on time payment record.  She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies and ingredients to make her nacatamales, such as pork, condiments, nacatamal leaves, firewood, gas, potatoes, rice, and fruit like pineapple, bananas, watermelon, oranges, and calalas.  Dolores is grateful for the help from the Kiva lenders who help people in poor countries like Nicaragua had a dignified means of working.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma, 39, lives with her husband and their four children in a house they own. She has been selling food for six months now, which has helped her to become well-known and earn clients over time. Her sales are very stable and she wishes to improve them significantly. Fatuma has requested a loan from Yehu, Kiva's field partner, for money to purchase staple grains, meat, flour, sugar, and vegetables. This will help her increase the quantity and variety of food she can offer. In this way, Fatuma can give better service to her customers, who will be very satisfied and will give positive feedback about her business, thus gaining new clients, which will be even more beneficial for her.

loans.use: to purchase staple grains, meat, flour, sugar, and vegetables.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en: Zuhura has been selling firewood for several years but she has decided to open a food stall to supplement her income. She says it is doing well. She has established a good clientele base. Zuhura is happy that she has many regular customers. At times sells to them on credit. Her aim is to own a hotel in the future. She is thankful for the support that she has gotten from Kiva and Yehu, which have helped her to have a dignified life. She intends to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, beans, etc.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, beans, etc.

loans.name: Leatitia

texts.en: Leatitia is 34 years old. She is married with three children. The oldest is 13 years old and the youngest is one. Her husband is a motorcyclist. She has been in business for three years. She wants a loan to buy more sorghum, corn, peanuts etc. She will keep the profits in her savings.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum, corn, and peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is married with two children. The oldest is five years old and the youngest is two and one half years old.  Her husband is a farmer. She has been in business for three years. She wants a loan to buy more rice and beans. The profit will pay for her kids’ school fees.

loans.use: To buy more beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Kabingo Women Association Group

texts.en: Damazo is a 30-year-old married man with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. After realizing that farming alone could not help him meet the day-to-day needs, he decided to start a produce and general merchandise retail shop. Price fluctuation is his major challenge while his dream is to trade at wholesale. He is a member of a group where each member guarantees the others in accessing a loan. Damazo intends to use the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: Sandra de 38 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Soledad, área metropolitana de Barranquilla con sus dos hijos de 15 y 18 años. Allí se dedica a generar ingresos mediante la venta de mercancía en miscelánea o punto comercial, ubicado en su propio domicilio.  Sus principales productos son la ropa, el calzado, los cosméticos y la papelería, los cuales vende de contado, a clientes del barrio y de sus alrededores, de lunes a domingo, iniciando desde las 9 de la mañana y terminando a las 9 de la noche o más, si es necesario. Inicialmente surgió a Sandra la idea de vender mercancía hace 8 años y por eso optó por incorporarse a una multinacional, para vender sus productos mediante catálogos o guías especializadas de productos. Poco a poco con sus ganancia, fue comprando vitrinas y luego su propio local,  en el que aun se encuentra y desde el cual distribuye sus productos, de contado  al consumidor final  que le compra al detal. Últimamente ofrece servicios de comunicaciones  por minutos, lo cual genera un nuevo ingreso y así aprovecha su clientela doméstica con el fin de activar ambos negocios. Su meta es lograr una gran variedad de productos y ubicar un nuevo punto comercial o sucursal,  con este mismo concepto. Su capacidad de comprar, para satisfacer la creciente demanda cada vez es menor, pero sus deseos de crecer son persistentes y por eso acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará Calzado, y ropa principalmente, pues desea que su clientela esté bien elegante celebrando la navidad y el año nuevo en familia y se sientan satisfechos con la compra realizada en su negocio ; esto es lo que justamente hace que su credikiva tenga éxito: que Sandra conoce el mercado y sabe como accionar en el para hace negociaciones yo gano tu ganas.
texts.en: Sandra, 38 years old, lives in the municipality of Soledad in the metropolitan area of Barranquilla with her two children, 15 and 18 years old. There she earns income by selling merchandise in a general store or business located in her own house. Her main products are clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and stationery, which she sells on a cash basis to customers from the neighborhood and surrounding areas every day starting at 9 in the morning and ending at 9 in the evening or later, if necessary. The idea of selling merchandise initially came to Sandra 8 years ago, and because of this she chose to join up with a multinational company to sell its products through catalogues or specialized product guides. Little by little she bought display cases with her earnings, and then her own premises, in which she can still be found and from which she distributes her products in cash to the end customer who buys it at retail. Lately she has been offering communication services by the minute, which generates new income. In this way she makes the most of her land line customers with the goal of boosting both businesses. Her goal is to achieve a wide variety of products and find a new place of business or branch with this same concept. Her capacity to buy in order to satisfy the growing demand is getting smaller and smaller, but her desire to grow is persistent. Therefore, she is taking out a Kiva loan, the first financing she has had with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy mainly shoes and clothing, since she wants her customers to be really elegant when celebrating Christmas and the New Year with family, and for them to be satisfied with the purchases made at her business. This is just what will make her Kiva loan successful: Sandra knows the market and knows how to take action in it to engage in win-win negotiations.

loans.use: to buy mainly shoes and clothing

loans.name: Domina

texts.en: Domina is 25 years old. She is married with two children. The oldest is three years old and the youngest is six months old. She has been in business for 10 years. She wants a loan to buy more foodstuffs such as corn flour, sugar, and rice. With the profit she will build a house.

loans.use: to buy corn flour, sugar, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Amudani

texts.en: Amudani is a 40-year-old married hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He operates a bar. With the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his children. An insufficient power supply affects his business while his plan is to buy a standby generator and diversify his business to offer other services. Like all good fathers, he desires to educate his children up to the University level. Amudani intends to use the loan to buy a generator and construct a video hall.

loans.use: to buy a generator and construct a video hall.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude is 27 years old. He is single. He has been in business for four years. He wants a loan to buy more sugar, salt, soap and rice. With the profit, he will build a house.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, and soaps to sell

loans.name: Josine

texts.en: Josine is 23 years old. She is married with one child who is two years old. Her husband is a security guard. She has been in business for two years. She wants a loan to buy more of three different brands of second hand clothing to sell. The profit will be placed into her savings.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Gisele

texts.en: Gisele is married with three children. The oldest child is six years old, and the youngest is three years old. Her husband is a businessman. She has been in business for 10 years. She wants a loan to buy more food items. With the profit, she will pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell.

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en: Mediatice is 40 years old. She is a widow with one child. The child is 20 years old. She wants a loan to buy more food items to sell in her retail store. With the profit, she will pay for her child’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a 38-year-old married woman. She has three children whose ages range from 10 years to 18 years. She describes herself as self-reliant and hard working. She runs an agribusiness where she sells tomatoes, onions, beans, and fruits like bananas, melons, and mangoes. She also has a retail business selling water to customers. 

Monicah has had this business for eight years and employs two staff members. Her business is located in a busy market area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as the outbreak of crop diseases, which affect her business greatly. She will use the loan of 11,100 KES to purchase a water tank, which will be used by her family members on household chores.

Her business goal is to expand her business and generate more income within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business with the help of financial support through SMEP DTM, Kiva's field partner.

loans.use: to purchase a water harvesting tank.

loans.name: Kiraaro Twekambe Group

texts.en: Robert is a member of the above group, where members guarantee each other to access a loan. In order to supplement his farming activities he decided to venture into a retail shop business. With the proceeds he has been able to meet his family's basic needs. Bad debts and price fluctuation are his major challenges, while his dream is to trade in wholesale. Robert intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Xavera

texts.en: Xavera is 22 years old. She is married with two children. The oldest is three years old, and the youngest is one years old. Her husband is a technician. She wants a loan to buy more items for her store. The profits will be added to her savings.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en: Alejandro, a dairy farmer from Tlaxcala, is constantly looking to reduce his operating costs. The price of milk on the open market is volatile, and the LP gas required to produce value-added products like yogurt and cheese is expensive. With his 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, Alejandro will be able to generate clean-burning, renewable biogas from the hundreds of kilograms of manure his cows produce weekly, allowing him to significantly decrease his energy costs. Moreover, he will use the fertilizer generated by the system on his animal feed - maize and alfalfa - allowing him to save on agrochemical fertilizer costs. This loan represents 43% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: María Del Rocío

texts.en: María del Rocio has always worked in the agricultural sector, focusing on innovation and sustainable development. She feels it is of utmost importance for farmers like herself to implement strategies and technologies to reduce the negative environmental impact stemming from raising animals and crops. She also notes that it is imperative for her to actively serve as an example or role model within the community. As a result, she is investing in a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to reduce ground water contamination from her animal waste, to generate renewable biogas to cover her energy needs, and to produce potent organic fertilizer, allowing her to grow crops without excessive agrochemical fertilizer usage. This loan represents 93% of the total cost of María del Rocio's Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 35 years old. She is married with two children. The oldest is four years old and the youngest is three years old. Her husband is her partner in business. She has been in business for five years. She wants a loan to buy more foodstuffs such as beans, alcohol, and soda. With the profit she will build a house.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es: Carmen con su anterior credikiva compró una fileteadora industrial, telas, hilos, correderas, botones  etc. Carmen dice que su anterior financiamiento fue de gran ayuda, para que las prendas tuvieran un excelente acabado y sus clientes se sintieran muy satisfechos, lo cual le ha abierto nuevos mercados. Desde que recibió su credikiva sus ventas han aumentado y han mejorado su situación económica. En la actualidad quiere  mejorar su productividad y por eso necesita una máquina recubridora de uso industrial, ideal para la costura de mangas y pantalones. Su credikiva tendrá éxito porque con él aumentará la calidad de sus costuras y su diversificación de productos se incrmentará. Su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Agradecida con las personas que nos prestan a nosotros los pequeños comerciantes y deseo que sigan con esta linda labor. "
texts.en: Carmen used her previous Kiva loan to buy an industrial filleting machine, fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, etc.  Carmen says that the previous loan was a great help so that the clothing would have excellent finishing touches and her customers would be very satisfied.  This has opened new markets for her.  Since receiving her Kiva loan her sales have increased and her financial situation has improved.  Now she wants to improve her productivity so she needs an industrial recovering machine, ideal for making sleeves and pants.  Her Kiva loan will be a success because she will be able to increase quality and diversify her products more.  Her message to the Kiva lenders is, “I’m grateful to those who lend to us, the small businesses, and I hope you continue doing this wonderful work.”

loans.use: to buy a recovering machine.

loans.name: Martha Lesbia

texts.es:
La joven Martha Lesbia habita en la comunidad de La Palma ubicado a 10 km del municipio de El Sauce, es una joven de 26 años, casada, madre de dos niños que por sus bajos recursos de sus padres no pudo terminar la escuela, se casó muy joven por circunstancias de la vida y heredó la actitud de emprendedora y luchadora de su madre que se dedican al pequeño comercio.

Con el apoyo de su esposo el cual le obsequió un pequeño capital para que iniciara su propio negocio y le ayudara con los gastos del hogar instaló una pequeña pulpería ubicada en su vivienda donde ofrece abarrotería en general, contando con la ventaja que es el único negocio que hay en el caserío y que así sus habitantes se evitan de viajar hasta el Sauce para adquirir lo necesario para el hogar.

En este momento por la buena temporada de enero donde las ventas aumentan necesita más capital para surtir el negocio por lo que necesita de un crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, pan, jabón, ace, papel higiénico, gaseosas y cosméticos.
Solicita a Kiva y Ceprodel que le apoyen con su solicitud para poder surtir de productos que demandan sus clientes y así poderlos satisfacer.
texts.en: Martha is a young woman who lives in the community of La Palma, 10 kilometers from the municipality of El Sauce, Nicaragua. She is 26 years old, married and has two children. Because her parents lacked resources, she was not able to finish school. She married at a very young age out of life's circumstances and inherited the enterprising and fighting spirit of her mother, who made a living in commerce. With the support of her husband, Martha was able to get a little capital to start her own business and help him with the household expenses. She installed a small convenience store in her home where she offers general groceries, taking advantage that there was no such business in the community and the inhabitants had to travel to El Sauce to acquire their household necessities. At this time sales have increased thanks to the nice January weather, and she needs more capital to stock her business. She is requesting the loan to purchase rice, sugar, bread, soap, toilet paper, soft drinks and cosmetics. She is asking Kiva and CEPRODEL to support her in this request so she will be able to stock up on the products her customers demand and thus be able to satisfy them.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, bread, soap, toilet paper, soft drinks and cosmetics.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a college graduate and lives in Congo Town, which is one of the most populated business areas in Montserrado County. He is married, and his wife is a Junior at the university. He has three children between the ages of 8 to 20. They are currently in school and live at home. 

For the past six years he has been operating a shop where he sells used car tires and motor bike tires. Some of the main challenges that he is facing are the prices of tires, because he has to buy the tires in USD and he sells them in LRD. He is requesting a loan to purchase more used car tires and motor bike tires to expand his business. He likes the business because it has allowed him to open a garage. He plans to educate his children about the business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more used car tires and motor bike tires to expand his business

loans.name: Leda

texts.es: Leda de 56 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad área metropolitana de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Ella es una mujer casada que tiene 5 hijos en edades de 19 a 32 años y se dedica a la venta de mercancía en miscelánea o punto comercial de exhibición y a la venta de pollo y carnes frías. Su experiencia como comerciante data de hace 5 años, cuando comenzó vendiendo cosméticos,  mediante guías especializadas de productos o catálogos en el año 2007. Poco a poco se empeñó en comprar vitrinas, para adecuar un punto de contacto con sus clientes, donde estos encontraran muchos  de los artículos que necesitaban, como ropa, accesorios femeninos y fantasía en general. Así aumentó su clientela y agregó posteriormente la venta de pollo y carnes frías, aprovechando la clientela que había contraído durante todo ese periodo. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito,  entre sus mejores clientes, de lunes a domingo y desde as 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, todo esto,  con el fin de lograr cada vez mas bienestar en su hogar. En su casa está ubicado su local comercial y en sus alrededores todos la conocen, por eso sus compradores cada vez son mayores. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cosméticos, pollo, cárnicos etc. Con esta inversión poco a poco ganará un nuevo mercado y aumentará una ve mas sus ingresos especialmente en la época navideña, donde el incremento de las ventas es muy usual todos los años y esto es lo que justamente hace que el credikiva sea exitoso.
texts.en:
Leda, 56, lives in the town of Soledad, in the metropolitan region of Barranquilla.  She's a married woman who has five children, ages 19 to 32, and makes a living selling merchandise in a shop and selling chicken and cold cuts.

Her experience as a merchant dates back five years, when she began selling cosmetics through specialized product catalogues in 2007.  Little by little she bought display cabinets to fix up her point of contact with her customers.  Here they found many of the articles they needed, such as clothing, women's accessories, and general jewelry.  This way she increased her clientele and later added sales of chicken and cold cuts, making the most of the customers she had acquired during this period.

She makes sales in cash and, among her better customers, on credit.  She works Monday through Sunday from 8 in the morning until 10 at night, with the goal of getting more well-being in her household all the time.  Her commercial business is located in her house, and all the people around her know her, so she has more buyers all the time.

This is why she's requesting a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She'll buy cosmetics, chicken, meat, etc.

With this investment, little by little she'll earn a new market and increase her investments again, especially in the Christmas season, when an increase in sales is normal every year.  This is exactly what makes the Kiva loan successful.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, chicken, and meat

loans.name: Quita

texts.en: Quita is a college student and lives in Congo Town, one of the most popular business areas in Montserrado County. She’s married, and her husband is a businessman. They have two children ages 2 and 6, both of whom are presently in school and live at home. She has been operating a shop where she sells drinks (beer, Malta, godfather gin, white spirit gin, etc.), milk, butter, spray gum, biscuits, candy, etc. She learned this way of selling from her husband, since he is the one who established her business for her. She spends 15 hours on her business since her shop is right in front of her house. Being one of the community leaders makes her proud about her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more drinks (beer, Malta, godfather gin, white spirit gin), milk, butter, spray gum, biscuits, candy, etc., for her business. Her plan is to build a house for children.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks (beer, Malta, godfather gin, white spirit gin, etc.), milk, butter, spray gum, biscuits, candy, etc., for her business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 40-year-old single woman with a child aged ten who is in school. She is a high school graduate and lives with her child in Margibi County, an area known for rubber plantations. For three years now, she has been involved in the sales of fashion clothes. She has many customers as her business is in a very good location in the market. She started her business with a loan from her child's father, and learned this way of selling from her friends. Esther spends eight hours per day on her business as the location of her shop is not close to her house. One problem she faces is that her shop is too small for her stock. She is requesting a loan to buy fashion clothes (blouses, jeans, trousers, dresses) and expand the size of her shop. She plans to expand her business even more and to educate her child.

loans.use: to buy fashion clothes (blouses, jeans, trousers, dresses) and expand the size of her shop

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Doña Martha habita en la comunidad de Las Pilas ubicado a 12 km del municipio de El Sauce, es una señora de 56 años, casada, madre de 10 hijos la mayoría independientes, que por sus bajos recursos no pudo terminar la escuela, se casó muy joven pero con los pasos de la vida y la experiencia se convirtió en una mujer emprendedora y luchadora que le ha transmitido esta fortaleza a todos sus hijos.

Casi la mayor parte de su vida se ha dedicado al pequeño comercio de manera ambulante de caminar día a día vendiendo de casa en casa alimentos para el consumo en el hogar pero hoy en la actualidad gracias al apoyo de su esposo y dos hijos que trabajan en Costa Rica le obsequiaron un pequeño capital para que iniciara un negocio estable donde instaló una pequeña pulpería ubicada en su vivienda donde ofrece abarrotería en general, contando con la ventaja que es el único negocio que hay en el caserío y que así sus habitantes se evitan de viajar hasta el Sauce para adquirir lo necesario para el hogar.

En este momento por la buena temporada de enero donde las ventas aumentan necesita más capital para surtir el negocio por lo que necesita de un crédito para la compra de leche, verduras, arroz, azúcar, pan, aceite y papel higiénico.
Solicita a Kiva y Ceprodel que le apoyen con su solicitud para poder surtir de productos que demandan sus clientes y así poderlos satisfacer.
texts.en: Martha lives in the community of Las Pilas, located 12 kilometers from the municipality of El Sauce, Nicaragua. She is 56 years old, married and has 10 children, the majority of whom are grown up and independent. Because of a lack of resources, she was not able to finish school and she married very young. With the passage of time and experience she has turned herself into a businesswoman and a fighter, and she has passed those traits down to all of her children. For nearly half her life she has made a living in commerce, going door to door selling household foods, but thanks to the support of her husband and two of their children who work in Costa Rica she was able to get a little bit of capital to start a stable business. She set up a small convenience store in her home offering general groceries, taking advantage that there had not been any such business in the community and the inhabitants had to travel to El Sauce to acquire their household necessities. Her sales have increased during this time of nice January weather, and she needs more capital to stock her business. She is requesting the loan to purchase milk, vegetables, rice, sugar, bread, oil and toilet paper. She is asking Kiva and CEPRODEL to support this request so she can stock up on the products her customers demand and thus satisfy them.

loans.use: to purchase milk, vegetables, rice, sugar, bread, oil and toilet paper.

loans.name: Emprendedores De Vitarte Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es sinónimo de emprendimiento es por eso que se proclaman como “EMPRENDEDORES DE VITARTE” hay 7 socias que la conforman y cada una es muy luchadora a su forma. La Srta. Julia es una estudiante de 21 años. Ella trabaja vendiendo productos de belleza todos los días. El siguiente préstamo lo solicito con la finalidad de poder invertir en sus productos y poder tener en stock y para poder utilizarlo en algunos gastos prioritarios. Julia junto a las demás integrantes de “EMPRENDEDORES DE VITARTE” agradecen por la confianza depositada en ellos por parte de los diferentes inversionistas que las apoyan mediante KIVA y EDAPROSPO.

Julia es la joven de polo blanco y se encuentra situada a la segunda de la parte izquierda de la foto.
texts.en:
This group is synonymous with the entrepreneurial spirit and it is for this reason they call themselves the "Entrepreneurs of Vitarte."  There are seven members that make up this group and each one is very hard-working.  Julia is a 21 year old student.  She works selling beauty products every day.  She is requesting the following loan with the goal of being able to invest in more products to have them in stock as well as to be able to use it for some priority expenses.  Julia, along with the other members of "Entrepreneurs of Vitarte," are grateful for the trust extended to them by the different investors that support them through KIVA and EDAPROSPO.  

Julia is the young lady in the white T-shirt who appears second from the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.es: El señor Norberto Habita en el Barrio la Borgoña del Municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa, el trabaja la tierra desde hace 30 años, sus cultivos son de Piña y Pitaha actualmente requiere de insumos  y fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento a 2 manzanas y media de Piña, con este financiamiento comprara lo siguiente: Urea, Triple 200, Completo  15-15-12 y Fertilizante asi sus cultivos incrementaran en calidad y el volumen de sus  ventan seran mejores y asi su familia tendra mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Norberto lives with his wife in the Borgoña neighborhood of the city of Ticuantepe.  He has been working the land for 30 years, raising pineapple and pitaha.  He needs supplies and fertilizers to maintain his two and a half plots of pineapple.  He will use the money from this loan to buy urea, and Triple 200, 15-15-12 fertilizer, so that his crops will increase in quantity and so that his family can have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Ihsan

texts.en:
Ihsan is a 32-year-old man. He is married and a father to one son and two daughters. Ihsan is employed and receives a low salary, which is not enough to cover his family's needs. For the past two years, Ihsan has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and a second source of income for the family.
Ihsan is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of making necessary repairs to the taxi he drives such as painting, and installing new wheels and lights. This will increase the taxi's capacity to work extra hours and enable Ihsan to take additional requests, which will improve the family's income. Ihsan is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: To repair the taxi

loans.name: Roque Santos

texts.es:
Roque tiene 29 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene cinco hijos. Se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y en la construcción. Este trabajo se lo enseño su padre desde pequeño. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar cemento, hierro, madera para el techo; debido a que necesita construir de nuevo su casa de bahareque, ya que se le esta cayendo. Con la inversión, espera construir su casa en un corto tiempo ya que los adobes ya los tiene listos. Su deseo es ir mejorando su casa, como el ponerle madera aserrada al techo, hacerle el piso de cemento, instalarle ventanas y puertas de madera, ya que las que tiene actualmente son de varas y lamina.
texts.en:
Roque is 29 years old, married, and has five children.  He works in farming and construction and he learned this from his father when he was a boy.

He is requesting a loan through Fundación Campo to buy cement, iron bars, and lumber for the roof because he needs to rebuild his home in Bahareque; it’s falling down.  This investment will allow him to build a house in a short time because he has the bricks ready.  He wants to improve his home with things like treated lumber for the roof, a cement floor, windows and wooden doors.  At the moment he only has iron bars

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a 47-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. As the good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the University level and to set up sustainable income-generating activities to secure their future. He is a farmer and he mainly grows beans, sorghum and tea. He also earns a salary as a government worker. Natural calamities such as drought and floods pose a great challenge to his business, while his plan is to venture into modern farming activities. Wilson intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Ciudad Real Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos! El grupo “CIUDAD REAL” está conformado por 7 socios, que se caracterizan por ser aguerridos y luchadores. La Srta. Liz es una joven de 24 años, es madre soltera y tiene un pequeño hijo de 4 años. Ella se dedica a vender productos de belleza y relata que es buena con las artes manuales y eventualmente logra vender algunas manualidades. El presente préstamo es solicitado con la finalidad de comprar mercadería y tener como stock productos de belleza. Ella junto a los demás integrantes de “CIUDAD REAL” agradecen por la confianza brindada.

Liz esta vestida con un polo color azul y es la mujer que está situada en la parte derecha de la foto  cargando a su menor hijo.
texts.en: Greetings! The "Ciudad Real" group consists of seven members who are known for being courageous fighters. Liz is a young woman of 24. She is a single mother and has a 4-year-old son. She makes a living selling beauty products and says that she is good with crafts and eventually wants to sell some craftwork. She is requesting the loan to purchase supplies so she has a stock of beauty products. Liz and the other members of "Ciudad Real" are grateful for your confidence. Liz is wearing a blue shirt on the right side of the photo holding her young son.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Erastus

texts.en:
Erastus is aged 40, and a farmer in Nkubu county in Kenya where he lives with his wife and two children.  Only one child has started school.  Erastus has been in farming for more than twenty years, producing eggs, milk, peas and tea, which he sells at the local market in his area.

He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry.  He will later sell the products and earn extra income which will help uplift his livelihood.  He will use some of the money to pay school fees for his children.  Erastus aspires to be the leading poultry farmer in his local area.

The high cost of feed is one of his major challenges in farming.

Erastus is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for its faster way of processing loans.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Karla, necesita un nuevo préstamo para invertir en el negocio, continuando en la venta de tortillas, para eso comprara maíz, leña, gas, para la preparación de la venta, esto le permitirá atender a los clientes con la calidad en sus productos.
Manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio, ha tenido trabajo y con las ganancias ayuda a su familia, este negocio ha crecido y en su familia sus hijos culminaron un año de escuela.
texts.en: Karla is requesting a new loan to continue with her tortillas business. She plans to purchase corn, firewood and propane to prepare the tortillas, allowing her to attract customers with the quality of her products. She says that the previous loan helped strengthen her business and the profits she earned helped her family. This business has grown and her children finished a year of school.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood and propane.

loans.name: María Ambrocia

texts.es:
María tiene 37 años de edad, esta casada y tiene cinco hijos. Se dedica al cultivo de tule (material que sirve para elaborar petates, canastos, etc.),  trabajo que le enseñaron sus padres desde muy pequeña. 

Ella ha comprado unas tejas para reparar el techo de su casa, debido a que actualmente es de plástico y unas pocas tejas para que no se lo bote el viento, las tejas se las compro a un vecino pero no le cancelo en su totalidad las tejas, sino que le debe más del 50%; por tal razón solicita a Fundación Campo, un préstamo para cancelar las tejas a su vecino. Con la inversión, ella podrá mejorar su vivienda, estando más segura con tejas que con plástico, por lo que sus hijos vivirán en un lugar más seguro y digo, debido a que en el invierno su casa se llana de agua. Su deseo es ir mejorando su casa, instalarle puertas de hierro ya que las que tiene son de madera las cuales elaboro su esposo.
texts.en:
María is a 37-year old woman, married and mother of five children. She makes a living cultivating tule (a material used to make backpacks, baskets, etc.), a job that she learned from her parents when she was a little girl. 

She has bought tiles to repair the roof of her house, which is currently made of plastic and needs a few tiles to prevent it from being thrown out by the wind. She bought the tiles from a neighbor, but did not fully paid them and still owes 50% of the price. In order to cancel her debt, she is requesting a loan to Fundación Campo. Thanks to this investment, she will be able to improve her house, making it safer with tiles than with plastic, and her children will live in a safer place (during the winter, her house fills with water). Her dream is to improve her house and to install iron doors to replace the current ones, made with wood by her husband.

loans.use: to cancel her debt from purchasing tiles for the roof of her house.

loans.name: Esperanza Veronica

texts.es: La Joven Esperanza es muy trabajadora tiene su propio  negocio es Modista, es soltera no tiene  hijos, habita en el  municipio de Ticuantepe, ella misma labora sus diseños y luego los vende al publico, actualmente quiere aprevechar la temporada de Inicio de clases para elaborar Uniformes  y asi tener  mejores ingresos, con este nuevo financiamiento comprar Materia prima para trabajarlos: Telas, Ciper, Botones, Hilos, Tijeras etc, Agradece el Apoyo por parte de Afodenic quien atravez de Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en:
Esperanza is very hardworking; she has her own business as a dressmaker. She is single and doesn’t have children. She lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She makes her own designs and later sells them to the public. Currently, she wants to take advantage of the start of school classes to make uniforms and therefore have better earnings. 

With this new loan, she will purchase premium material for working: fabric, zippers, buttons, thread, scissors, etc. She is grateful for the support on the part of AFODENIC, which they have given her through funds from Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase premium material for producing her designs.

loans.name: Altanchimeg

texts.en: Altanchimeg is 39 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in a small house in the Orhon province of Mongolia. Her husband Badarch, 44, runs a taxi service within the town and also helps her brother take care of livestock in the countryside during the summer. Her daughter Uranchimeg, 16, son Anhbayar, 14, and Otgonbayar, 12, go to local schools. Altanchimeg had been living in countryside herding livestock for years and moved to the province center in 2000 and started her business of organic dairy products and selling them to local customers. She has built a strong relationship with customers and suppliers. She is now requesting 600'000MNT to purchase large amounts of organic milk products to produce and sell various kinds of organic dairy products. She is a hardworking, friendly and open-minded woman who says "My daughter is going to enroll university next year and my sons are soon to be enrolled in universities so we need to start saving for our children's tuition"

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic milk products to produce and sell various kinds of organic dairy products.

loans.name: Orquidia Marisol

texts.es:
Orquídia, necesita un nuevo préstamo para continuar en la venta de los tamales, se comprara maíz, frijol, leña, que son los necesarios para poder producir los tamales, esto le permite que su negocio continúe.
Con el préstamo anterior Orquídia ha logrado mejorar el negocio, ayudando a su familia, tiene una hija de cinco meses, se encuentra feliz de contar con un nuevo miembro en el hogar.
texts.en:
Orquídia needs a new loan to continue with her tamale sales. She will purchase corn, beans, and firewood, which are what she needs to make tamales. This makes it possible for her business to continue. 

With the previous loan, Orquídia was able to improve her business and help her family. She has a daughter of five months and is happy to have a new member of the family.

loans.use: purchase corn, beans, and firewood

loans.name: Iris Del Pilar

texts.es:
La Srta. Iris del Pilar, tiene 25 años de edad, es estudiante de la carrera de Contabilidad, iniciará el penúltimo semestre. Escogió ésta carrera porque le gusta los analisis de los Estados Financieros, y porque le cauisaba curiosidad el manejo de las empresas. Le va bien, el único obstáculo que ha encontrado es que algunos horarios de los cursos se cruzan con el horario de su trabajo, en el cual ella emplea todo lo aprendido en la universidad ya que está trabajando en el área contable.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en el pago del semestre y así obtener un descuento por el pago total del ciclo.
texts.en:
Iris del Pilar is a 25 year old student majoring in accounting. She will start her second to last semester. She chose her major because she likes analyzing financial statements and because of a curiosity in the management of businesses. Things are going well for her. Her only obstacle is that some course schedules overlap with her work schedule. In her job, she is applying everything she has learned in college because she is working in accounting. 
The loan will be used to pay for the semester, and get a discount for paying this cycle’s tuition in full.

loans.use: pay the total amount of tuition for the cycle.

loans.name: Ricardo De Jesús

texts.es: El señor Ricardo Habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa e hijos, ella labora en el Hospital del municipio y entre los dos se comparten los gastos del hogar, el tiene mas de 20 años de trabajar la tierra y gracia a sus cultivo ha sacado adelnate a su familia, con este financiamiento dara mantenimiento a 2 manzanas de Piña para que no se infesten de plagas y puedan tener un optimo cuido, comprara lo siguiente: Fertilizante, Fungicidas, Completo, Triple 20, Urea.
texts.en:
Ricardo lives in the Ticuantepe municipality together with his wife and children. His wife works in the municipal hospital. They share the household expenses between the two of them. Ricardo has worked the land for over 20 years, and thanks to his crops, has been able to get his family ahead. 

He wants to use this loan to maintain two manzanas [about 3.5 acres] of pineapples so that they don’t get infested by pests, and so that he can give them optimum care. He will purchase fertilizers, fungicide, Triple 20, and urea.

loans.use: purchase necessary supplies to maintain his pineapple crop

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.es:
Saludos desde ¡Perú!, El grupo “EBENEZER” está conformado por 7 socios muy emprendedores y carismáticos. La Sra. Nelly es socia del grupo, tiene 52 años y es una mujer muy aguerrida. Ella se dedica a vender productos de consumo humano en su bodega, que se encuentra situada en una parte de su casa. El préstamo es solicitado con la finalidad de abastecer su negocio con productos como leche, panetón, azúcar, chocolate, entre otros. Nelly junto a los demás integrantes agradecen a KIVA y EDAPROSPO, pero en especial mandan un saludo efusivo a los inversionistas que depositaron su confianza en ellos.

La Sra. Nelly es la mujer que viste de negro y es la segunda de la parte izquierda de la foto.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru!  The "Ebenezer" group is made up of seven enterprising and charismatic members.  One member, Nelly, is 52 years old and is a very courageous woman.  She sells food in her small grocery store, which is run out of her house.  She is applying for this loan in order to stock up the store with products such as milk, paneton, sugar and chocolate, among other things.  Nelly and the rest of the team are thankful to Kiva and Edaprospo but they especially send a huge thanks to the investors who are putting their confidence in them.

In the photo, Nelly is the second woman on the left and is wearing a black top.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a small grocery store.

loans.name: Lucia Manuela

texts.es:
La señora Lucia Manuela es madre soltera, tiene 36 años de edad, curso los 2 años de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales 1 esta estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa típica para mujeres, inicio este negocio, gracias al apoyo de su familia, y  hasta el momento lleva 7 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería: cortes, delantales, suéteres y guipiles, lo cual puede hacer que su negocio crezca y venda mejor, espera en el futuro seguir mejorando la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucia Manuela is a 36 year old single mother who studied through her second year in primary school. She has two children; one of whom is in school. She sells clothing for women. She started this business thanks to support from her family and now has 7 years of experience. 
 
She is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise: cuts of fabric, aprons, sweaters, and huipils [Central American indigenous dresses] which can help her business grow and have better sales. Her hopes for the future are to continue improving the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: purchase clothing merchandise

loans.name: Rosmelly Karina

texts.es: Rosmelly es una joven estudiante de la carrera de diseño de modas, actualmente tiene 23 años y cursa su 4to ciclo en su instituto. Ella se dedica diariamente a confeccionar, remallar y reparar trajes en su pequeño negocio que se sitúa en su hogar. Ella comenta que desde pequeña tuvo la afición sobre los trajes y diseños, es por eso que actualmente lucha día a día para ser mejor estudiante y persona.
