El préstamo solicitado es para poder pagar sus pensiones y comprar algunos materiales requeridos en sus clases. Ella agradece a Kiva y Edaprospo y a todas las personas que apoyan mediante estas entidades para que pueda seguir forjándose un futuro y un camino en la vida.
texts.en: Rosmelly is a young fashion design student.  She is 23 years old and currently in her fourth semester.  Every day she works making and mending clothes in her little business that she runs out of her home.  She says that since she was a child, she has had a passion for clothing and design and that is why she is working every day to become a better student and person.  The loan that she is applying for will be used to pay her inscription at school and to buy some materials that she requires for classes.  She thanks Kiva, Edaprospo and all those who are supporting her through these organisations and helping her to shape her future and her path in life.

loans.use: to pay for inscription and to buy study materials.

loans.name: Nathali Giovanna

texts.es: La Srta. Nathali Giovanna, tiene 31 años de edad. Ella ha culmidao sus estudios en la carrera de Educación y está por iniciar los trámites de su Licenciatura para poder inscribirse en el curso de una Maestría en la carrera de Educación, el cual hoy en día es muy necesario debido a la competencia que existe en nuestro país para poder postular a un puesto de trabajo en el área docente. El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en el pago del trámite para la obtención de su Licenciatura y la inscripción al curso de Maestría en Eduación.
texts.en: Nathali Giovanna is 31 years old.  She is about to start a Masters in education.  She is now completing the last bits of paperwork of her undergraduate studies so that she can matriculate in university to become a teacher.  It is very necessary to do this due to the competition in our country when applying for teaching work.  The loan will be used to pay for the final stages of her undergraduate studies and to matriculate on a postgraduate degree in education.

loans.use: to pay for her studies to become a teacher.

loans.name: Lorena Luz

texts.es: Lorena de 24 años de edad vive al sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 2 a 8 años. Allí tienen su propio negocio, a través del cual vende artículos de fantasía, gafas, bisutería etc. Actividad en la que tiene 4 años de experiencia y que fue iniciada por su cónyuge y que ella ha ido mejorando el negocio poco a poco, hasta lograr tener su local propio. Sus ventas las realiza de contado, con una frecuencia diaria trabajando 12 horas cada día. Sus principales clientes son transeúntes, vecinos y referidos, que se han convertido en sus clientes fijos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará al por mayor y de contado juguetería, pues se acerca la temporada navideña y sus ventas en estos artículos se incrementan y ella aprovechará la demanda, que ocurre justamente a final de año y que hacen de su credikiva   una inversión exitosa que aumenta sus ingresos .
texts.en:
Lorena is 24 and lives in the south of the city of Barranquilla with her husband and their 3 children, ages 2 to 8. There she has her own business where she sells novelties, glasses, and costume jewelry. She has four years of experience in this line of work. It was started by her husband, and she has improved it little by little, and has managed to open her own shop. She makes her sales with cash and works 12 hours every day. Her main customers are passersby, neighbors, and referrals that have become regular customers. 

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Maria Santo Domingo Foundation. She will use it to purchase wholesale toys with cash. Christmas is coming, and sales for those items increases. She wants to take advantage of the demand which happens right at the end of the year. The Kiva loan can help her make a successful investment and increase her income.

loans.use: purchase wholesale toys and novelties with cash.

loans.name: Betty Isabel

texts.es: Betty de 58 años tiene 2 negocios, por un lado vende productos mediante guías especializadas y por otro lado ofrece el servicio de alquiler de maquinas para lavar. Su actividad de comerciante data desde hace 10 años, cuando inició vinculándose a una empresa que ofrece sus productos mediante catálogos; posteriormente fue comprando poco a poco las maquinas lavadoras y de esta manera ha ido creciendo. Hoy vende ropa masculina y femenina, lencería, artículos para el hogar, productos de tocador, de contado y también a crédito. Su meta es aumentar el número de sus clientes y apoyar a sus hijos en la educación de sus nietos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará vestidos para damas, caballeros e infantil, porque quiere alegrar la navidad y las fiestas de año nuevo de sus clientes, logrando que con sus prendas de vestir, se sientan muy elegantes y felices en familia en estas fiestas tan importantes para ellos, mientras tanto Betty estará cada vez que venda una prenda, ganando un poco mas de dinero.
texts.en:
Betty is 58 and has two businesses. On one hand, she sells products through specialized catalogue guides. On the other hand, she offers the service of renting out machines for washing. She has been in sales for 10 years. When she started, she connected herself to a business that offers its products through catalogues. Later, she purchased machines for washing one at a time, and his way has grown. Today she sells clothing for men and women, lingerie, home goods, and toiletries. She accepts cash and credit. Her dream is to increase the number of customers and support her children in the education of her grandchildren.  

Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. Through the loan, she will purchase clothing for women, men, and children. She wants to bring cheer to Christmas and New Year’s parties for her customers. Through selling her clothing, she wants to make them feel very elegant and happy with their families during these festivals that are so important to them. Meanwhile, each time Betty sells an article of clothing, she will earn a little more money.

loans.use: purchase clothing for women, men, and children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Kyenzigye Group

texts.en:
This story was given by George William, who is squatting in the front row with a white cloth in hand.

George William is a 45-year-old married man with seven children who are all in school. He operates a bicycle and motorcycle spare parts shop and garage, plus a maize milling machine. George started these businesses in 1992 in order to boost the family income and provide basic needs to the family.

George wants the loan to be able to complete the roofing of his residential house and have a decent home for the family. His family is excited about celebrating the new year is a more descent accommodation since they are considering of inviting some relatives over for the festive season they will have a great time.

George's major clients are residents of his village and the outskirts of Kagadi town where he operates the businesses. His major challenge is the limited capital plus labor force to assist in the operation of the business, as he wishes to expand it and provide employment to school dropouts. George's wish is to see financial services availed to him and his community whenever they are in need of funding for their businesses.

loans.use: To buy roofing materials for his incomplete residential house.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a 54-year-old married man with eight children and two dependents.

He is a farmer who grows the popular Ugandan plantains and keeps animals. He started this activity in 1990 with the purpose of earning a living and also paying tuition for his children. His clients are people around the town.

The loan will help him to buy construction materials for his incomplete residential house. He has been building in phases, but is excited that Ugafode is giving him a helping hand in the form of a micro-mortgage loan that is very affordable in terms of interest rates. Building a decent permanent house has been his dream since he was from a humble background, where they used to scramble for a sleeping place, but he wants to make a difference for his children.

He hopes to build rentals in the future to help him pay tuition at university since most of his children are soon entering university.

His challenges are animal diseases and the expensive veterinary drugs that have affected his milk production.

He is a hardworking man. If given support, he can strive to achieve his intended objectives.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to finish his incomplete house.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Kilifi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married businesswoman who runs a clothes business which she has been operating for three years though she works as a hawker. In this business she sells shawls, handbags, pants, shoes etc. 

She learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are exhaustion due to trekking and competition. 

Grace is applying for a loan of 41,900 KES to purchase additional stocks of bed sheets, shoes and other secondhand clothing. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help open a stall in the town. Her dream is to open a larger boutique which can provide more income to educate her daughter.

loans.use: to buy secondhand bed sheets, shoes and other items.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in the Kilifi area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is a married father of one child and owns a green grocery stall which he has been operating for four years. In this business, Joseph sells greens, fruits, vegetables, mineral water, flour and other soft drinks, and other items. He began the business through the capital he raised from the casual jobs he once performed.

Joseph learnt about Milango through a friend and joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. The challenges he is facing are bad debts and high cost of transport. 

Joseph is applying for a loan of 52,250 KES shillings to buy new stocks of potatoes, onions, tomatoes, and other groceries. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to expand his business. His plans for the future are to start other businesses and also open stalls in different areas.

loans.use: to buy new stocks of potatoes, onions, tomatoes, and other groceries.

loans.name: Muhamudou

texts.en: Muhamudu is aged 51, but has still been renting a house for his second wife. This has proved expensive since they have many children, being Muslim, so he always has to rent a big house which is expensive. From the taxi  which is his business, he has been able to educate all his 14 children but since some of them are completing school, he has used some of the income from the taxi to finally build a house for his wife and children. He therefore needs the loan to do flooring and plastering of the house which will soon be habitable and save him the burden of renting. He believes the money from the vehicle transport will help him pay back the loan. Muhamudu is standing in front of the house he wants to complete.

loans.use: To finish his incomplete house

loans.name: Kisa Kya Mukama Wamala Group

texts.en:
Mary is a 56-year-old widow living in rural Wakiso, around 30 kilometres away from the city. She is a farmer who fends for her family and pays the tuition of her children. Mary is so hard working that she has even managed to build a permanent house for her children. She recently bought plastic chairs that are rented for small functions with the help of the loan from UGAFODE the previous cycle. She hopes to buy many more chairs so that she can earn more from them. 

She wants the loan to buy maize seeds and hire labourers for planting them during this time when it is raining. She encourages fellow women to be innovative and not to under look their potential because all things are possible. Phillip, another group member, makes mats out of papyrus. His main challenge is the cold weather which prevents them from drying and in turn produces poor quality mats. He hopes to diversify to agriculture if he gets funds. The group members are grateful for the partnership UGAFODE has developed with them.

loans.use: To buy seeds and hire a labourer for planting them

loans.name: Together We Can Group

texts.en: This group is found in one of the suburbs on the outskirts of the city. Justine, one of the members, sells foodstuffs for daily household use like the popular plantain, cassava, potatoes, tomatoes, and eggplants among other foods. When she began the business in 2000, she had only 20,000 UGX but through her small profits, she has managed to grow the business to a reasonable amount of capital. With the loan, she will be able to buy her own kiosk so that she is able to stock many things and save the money she is currently paying on rent. She plans to buy a piece of land on which she will build a plot of land in the future. Despite the challenges, Justine is hard working and committed to see her dream of building her own shop come true.The eighth person in front on the extreme right is the UGAFODE Credit officer in charge of the group.

loans.use: To buy her own kiosk

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mwirichia

texts.en:
Mwirichia lives in Nanyuki area of Central Province, Kenya. He owns a tea tree farming business. He started this business from income from subsistence farming. The extract from tea trees is used to manufacture cosmetics. He began his tea tree farming business this year. He is married and has six children.

He learnt about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit. The main challenge in the area has been the seasonal weather. This he believes will be sorted once he purchases a water pump.

Mwirichia is applying for a loan of 20,730 KES to buy tea tree seedlings for his business. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings and looks forward to strengthening his farming by increasing the acreage.

loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bee hives.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bee hives.

loans.name: Faima

texts.en:
Faima is 30 years old and lives in the town of Iganga, in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 4 years, Faima has been working hard to manage her salon, which does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Faima has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a bigger dryer and more hair extensions, and will help Faima to generate greater profits and improve on her family stardands of living and pay for her medical bills. Faima hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another big salon in town. 

Faima is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Faima who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy a bigger dryer and more hair extensions

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Tusakimu Group Masajja

texts.en:
Tusakimu development group was formed by the group members with the aim of developing their families and the community. The group is comprised of both men and women.
Betty, a group member, is a married mother of four children, all in school. Her main source of income is selling shoes from market to market, assisted by her husband.  They do this to pay tuition and meet the necessities of their children. Their dream is to build a house of their own before their years advance.  Her main challenge is working in the open where she is inconvenienced by weather changes. It gets either too hot or rainy at times, dislocating her business. Despite the challenges, she is positive that the situation will change and they will be able to find a permanent place to sell their stock.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to to purchase bee hives.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bee hives.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and  all her children go to  school. She is not looking after additional members of the family.
She has been running a retail shop for basic commodities for ten years, working seven days a week. She does not have an additional source of income.
She has requested for a loan of 1,200,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy stock of soda, beer, water, sugar, flour, rice and fruit drinks for sale. Her challenges include high transport costs. Her dream is to turn her business into a wholesale. She joined MCDT because she considers the loan interest to be fair. She stays with her husband and the family has  access to electricity and no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda, beer, boxes of mineral water, sugar, flour, rice and fruit drinks for sale

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all of them are attending school. She does not look after any other family members. She rents a house with access to electricity, but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Working seven days a week, Annet has been selling green bananas in a market at retail for eight years. She does not have any other source of income. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy more bunches of  green bananas for sale. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to be able to expand the business and become a wholesaler for all kinds of raw food. She joined MCDT because it is easy to become a member.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, two of whom currently attend school. She is also looking after her two sisters and brother.

She has been selling charcoal from her home at retail for 10 years and works seven days a week. She also does some farming as another source of income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. She generates additional income by selling used clothes . Her challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to buy a lorry so that she can stop renting other people's vehicles. She joined MCDT because it is easy to become a member. She stays in her own house without access to either electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, two of whom currently attend school.  She is not looking after any other family members.  She lives in a rented house with access to electricity but not piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.	

For the past 10 years, she has been selling second hand clothes in the market.  She works six days a week and has no other source of income.  She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO in order to buy more second hand shirts, blouses, skirts and bed sheets to sell.  One of her main challenges is transportationand ever increasing prices of used clothes.  Her dream is to turn her business into a wholesale business.  She joined MCDT because of the low loan interest charged and even wanted to access school fees loans so that she can educate her children up to university.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes to sell like shirts, blouses, skirts and bed sheets

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Fausta lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is a widow and has five children, none of whom currently attend school.  She is not looking after any other members of the family.  She lives in her house without access to either electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and medication.					

She has been selling secondhand clothes in a retail shop for 10 years and she works seven days a week.  She also works as a tailor as another source of income.  She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to buy second hand clothes and rolls of cloth.  The main challenges she faces include seasonality and the increasing prices of used clothes.  Her dream is to expand her business and to employ people.  She joined MCDT mainly because of timely loans.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes and rolls of cloth.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a soft-spoken and assertive businessman with dreams of improving his mobile money transfers business.  He is widowed and lives with his daughters in his hometown of Chililabombwe, Zambia. 

Richard explained that he became a mobile money transfer agent in the year 2009, because he saw how people in his community were struggling to move their money. He says the business has grown as most people have come to learn about his business and genuinely like the service that he provides. Running this business comes with its own challenges, like working capital. Richard spends his days running to and from the bank to convert the money he has from cash to electronic and vise-versa, so that he can serve his customers. It is for this reason that he is taking out this Kiva loan, so that he can add to his working capital to help him serve more customers and make more profits.

Richard is grateful for the opportunity to be on Kiva and is happy that finally he will be able to slowly begin to realize his dream of improving his business. He looks forward to taking out another loan.

This picture was taken in Richard's shop in Chililabomwe.

loans.use: To increase his working capital so that he can have more customers send and receive money from his shop

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret  is a single mother of six children and none of her children goes to school. She also takes care of her cousins and grand daughters. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for ten years. She generates additional income from a restaurant. She has applied for a loan of 1500000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She works from her home and sells retail to all categories of people and works seven days a week. Her major business challenges includes seasonality, thieves and defaulters. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to start going to villages of Luwero district for charcoal. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees for the cousins and grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim is a 35-year-old married man with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Seven years ago, he decided to venture into motorcycle transport to help meet the family's needs, given its low cost of operation. He also grows cocoa to supplement his income sources, and we found him in his plantation at the time of the interview. He started as a hired driver who had to remit 80% of his daily earnings to his boss, but, through hard work, he has been able to buy his own motorcycle. High license fees and poor roads are his major constraints, while his dreams are to own a transport company and educate his children up to university. Salim intends to use this loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy motorcycles for a transport business.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is a thirty-three-year-old married woman with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is teacher by profession and was inspired into service by her mother who is now retired. In order to supplement the low salary she earns, she also has a retail shop. Good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children up to university, and her business goal is to own a wholesale shop. Stella intends to use the loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Preng

texts.en:
Preng was able to buy a dairy cow with the previous loan and repaid the whole amount in full. His income now has significantly increased due to an increase in dairy products.

While he wants to wish everyone all the best in the new year, he also wants to thank all the lenders for their help and generosity.

loans.use: to build a fence around his property to prevent further damage from animals

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: Luis con su anterior credikiva compró víveres en mayor cantidad y ganó descuentos especiales, lo cual favoreció su negociación y esto fue gracias a Kiva. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento, con el que comprará ranchos, víveres, cárnicos, así tendrá un mejor surtido, para la época de mayor movimiento comercial del año: “el mes de Diciembre”. Esta es la razón por la cual tendrá éxito su inversión, por eso dice a sus financiadoras de Kiva: “ Gracias, sigan apoyando a los microempresarios de Barranquilla, ya que estamos cumpliendo algunos objetivos que  teníamos. “
texts.en: Luis bought produce wholesale with his previous Kiva loan and obtained special discounts. This was good for his business and was thanks to Kiva. Right now, he is applying for a new loan. With it, he will buy prepared meals, produce, and meat. This way, he will have a bigger selection for the busiest time of the year, the month of December. That is why his investment will be successful, and that is why he tells his Kiva investors: "Thank you, keep supporting the micro-businesses of Barranquilla, since we are meeting some goals that we had."

loans.use: to buy prepared meals, produce and meat

loans.name: Julia Noelia

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer de 37 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, gracias a su esfuerzo Julia pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Secretariado, lamentablemente no ha podido encontrar trabajo en este rubro, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver novelas y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines Rojos para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Julia trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad y bebidas, Julia trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Julia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una vitrina, una nevera, un andamio, variedad de abarrotes y bebidas, de esta manera Julia tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado y abastecido para poder atender a mas clientes, así pues Julia seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia, age 37, lives with her husband and two small children in the city of Ica.  She loves them, and they are her primary reason for living.  She is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person.  She and her husband devote all of their efforts towards getting their family ahead.  

Thanks to her effort, Julia was able to study for a career as a professional secretary.  Unfortunately, she has not been able to find work in this field.  In her free time she likes to read novels, and she sometimes cooks the delicious ‘Tallarines Rojos’ [similar to spaghetti] to share with her family.

On her own initiative, and with great effort and diligence, Julia works in her small business selling groceries.  She sells basic needs products and drinks.  Julia works approximately ten hours every day.  She believes it is going well for her because of the good prices and the kind service she gives her customers.

Julia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks the help they have given her, she will be able to buy a display case, a refrigerator, shelving, and a variety of groceries and drinks.  This way Julia will have her business in better condition and better stocked.  She will do this in order to be able to tend to more customers.  This way Julia will continue working and putting forth great effort in order to achieve her big dream of being able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a display case, a refrigerator, shelving, and a variety of groceries and drinks.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina es una mujer de 39 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, gracias a su esfuerzo Delfina pudo estudiar pequeños cursos de repostería, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Delfina trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de desayunos, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 4 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón, precios bajos y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Delfina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una pequeña vitrina, tapers descartables y embases para bebidas, de esta manera Delfina tendrá mejor acondicionado su negocio y atenderá a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia empresa.
texts.en:
Delfina is a 39 year old woman. She lives in the city of Chincha with her husband and two small children, whom she loves and who are her main reason for living. She is a kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person who with her husband dedicates all her efforts to getting her family ahead. Thanks to her efforts, Delfina was able to take some small courses in pastry making. In her free time, she likes to listen to music and sometimes cook a delicious Arroz con Pollo to share with her family.  

Omn her own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Delfina  works at her small business selling breakfasts. She works every day from the early hours of the morning and can do it for approximately 4 hours. She is happy doing her work and believes that it is going well for her because of her good cooking, low prices and the friendly treatment she gives to her customers.

Delfina is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she can buy a small display case, and disposable to-go boxes and cups for beverages. This way, Delfina will have her business better set up and can serve more customers. She can keep working and striving to achieve her big dream of owning her own business.

loans.use: to buy a display case and disposable to-go boxes and cups.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel con su credikiva, compró productos de belleza y ropa con los cuales conquistó a sus clientes, por eso sus ventas aumentaron, su clientela es mayor y ha mejorado sus ingresos. Ella dice a sus financiadoras: “Gracias a ustedes por abrirme las puertas para darme un crédito y les pido que continúen ayudando a la gente trabajadora para que prosperen. “ En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento por Kiva, con le cual comprará ropa escolar y productos de belleza, que han sido encargado por sus clientes y esto es lo que hace que su credikiva sea todo un éxito.
texts.en:
With her Kiva loan Marible bought beauty products and clothes, which she used to win over new customers.  This is why her sales increased, she has more customers, and she has improved her income.

She says to her Kiva lenders, “Thank you for opening the doors for me and giving me a loan.  I ask you to continue helping hard-working people so that they will prosper.”

She is currently applying for a new Kiva loan.  She will use it to buy school clothes and beauty products, which her customers have ordered.  This is what will make her Kiva loan a complete success.

loans.use: to buy school clothes and beauty products.

loans.name: Rositas De Panamericana Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSITAS DE PANAMERICANA”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Reyna es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de fruta, venta de chompa a máquina, confección de ropa deportiva, producción de zapatos, mantas de vicuña, tienda de carnicería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Reyna es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su madre quien es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de ropa deportiva que aprendió de su madre hace años y con el pasar del tiempo decidió establecer su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de la frontera de Bolivia y Perú, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos económicos para sus estudios.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones.
texts.en:
The “ROSITAS DE PANAMERICANA”  communal bank will begin its second cycle Pro Mujer as a part of the Panamericana Center. It is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors of which Reyna is the Secretary. The businesses that the members of the association run are varied. Among them are: selling food, selling fruit, selling machine knitted sweaters, making shoes, selling vicuña blankets and a butcher shop.

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-business women, including Reyna. She indicates that this is the first time she has been a member of Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of her mother, who is a member of the institution. Right now, she has a business making and selling sports clothing, which she learned from her mother some years ago. Over time, she was able to establish her own independent business. 
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital by buying fabric that she will acquire at the border of Bolivia and Peru wholesale. Later she will make the clothes and sell them in her sales space. This work allows her to generate financial resources for her studies.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the meetings.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is working with the SWAP Trust (Sanitation Water and People) in Botswana which is a Barefoot Solar Power Distributor.

She is the first of a network of "village entrepreneurs" in Botswana being supported by the Trust to introduce "green" and alternative energy products to the rural disadvantaged areas.

                                                                  *******

“Hi – they call me Abi and I have a home in the remote and under-developed village of Jamataka, which is about 25 kilometres west of Francistown, Botswana, on the road to the Orapa diamond mine.

“My husband passed away 12 years ago leaving me with three children to support, and it has been a difficult struggle to make sure they were properly fed and educated.

“In Jamataka there is no electricity,  running water or proper roads, which makes life  difficult. But I hope to change all that by introducing new solar technology to this community first, then in the ten surrounding villages.

“In so doing I will not only bring myself an income but will offer employment to many other people in the area who will also earn money.

“With Kiva loan, I  buy my first stock of solar products, which will be so popular with all the people, especially the school kids who will be able to have lights at night, which will allow them to study and do their homework.

“As for their parents, it will be so wonderful as candles and paraffin are now so expensive and also dangerous.  Many people suffer burns and even die from accidents with these things.

“I have done voluntary work for our VDC – the Village Development Committee – for many years and I love helping people and the community improve their way of life.  If we all work together and help each other we can have much better living conditions.”

loans.use: to buy and sell Barefoot Power's solar lighting products.

loans.name: Andy Paul

texts.es:
Andy es un joven muy trabajador y entusiasta, vive al lado de su pareja a quien queire mucho y fruto de ese gran amor y cariño tienen un pequeño hijo de 1 año de edad, el cual es la razon de vivir y sobre todo su motor y motivo para poder luchar cada dia por verlo feliz y sobre todo darle ese gran amor de padre. la vivienda de Andy se ubica en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy calido y acogedor y sobre todo se caracteriza por la amabilidad y alegria de sus habitantes. Desde muy joven Andy ha lucahdo por ir creciendo cada dia y es asi que con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera tecnica de Diseño Grafico y luego de mucho ahorro y dedicacion inicio su negocio de venta de ropa en el cual ya lleva trabajando hace un año, andy le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al dia y puede atender hasta 10 clientes diariamente; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante sobre todo por el bien de su familia.

Andy esta muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podra comprar mercaderia para su negocio como polos faldas, bividis, trajes de baño, enter otros; de esta manera el podra tener mayor variedad de procuctos para ofrecer a sus clientes y sobre todo mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:" Tener su casa propio y formar su empresa de publicidad".
texts.en:
Andy is a very hard-working and enthusiastic young man.  He lives with his life partner, who he loves very much.  Their loving relationship has produced a little one year old child.  His son is his reason for living.  Above all else, his son is his driving force and motivation to struggle every day to see his son happy and to especially give him a father’s great love.

Andy’s house is in the city of Pucallpa, which is known for its warm and welcoming climate.  It is especially known for the kindness and joy of its inhabitants.  Ever since he was very young, Andy has struggled to keep growing every day.  This is the way that, with great effort, he managed to study for a technical career in Graphic Design.  

After saving a lot, and with much dedication, he started his business of selling clothes.  He has been doing this work for one year.  Andy devotes around ten hours a day to his business.  He can take care of up to ten customers daily.  He believes that it is going well for him in his business because he is very kind.  The biggest reason it is going well is that he has a great desire to get ahead for the good of his family.

Andy is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to buy merchandise for his business.  He will buy items like polo-type shirts, skirts, tank tops, and bathing suits, among others.  This way he will be able to have a greater variety of products to offer to his customers.  Most of all, his income will improve.  He will continue struggling to be able to make his biggest dream a reality, to have his own house and to set up an advertising company.

loans.use: to buy summer clothes.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya and has a clothes shop which has been running for three years. He employs two other people. He is a married father of thirteen children. He also farms rice and sugar cane at his rural home and has a transport business, owning a motorcycle. 

Erick aspires to own other larger business space from where he can sell goods. James learnt of Milango from his friends and is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of clothes. The challenge in the current business is the fluctuating purchase prices of clothes.

Erick believes the additional income from this loan will help him build provide good education to his children.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothes.

loans.name: Ocomistu Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “OCOMISTU”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Justina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, venta de comida, venta de mantas, costura de chamarras, compra de ganado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Justina es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que le fue a visitar a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de comida que emprendió por iniciativa propia desde hace tres años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, aceite y papa) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos económicos para su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones en grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank “OCOMISTU” will be in its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana. The bank has nine members, and the board is headed by its president Justina. The bank's members run a variety of businesses: selling prepared foods and blankets, sewing jackets, and selling livestock.

This loan will benefit micro businesses such Justina's. She joined Pro Mujer a year ago at the invitation of one of the institution's consultants who visited her house. She started her business selling food three years ago on her own initiative. This loan will increase her working capital so that she can buy wholesale rice, oil, and potatoes at fairs in the city of El Alto to prepare food to sell in her community. The business generates income for her family; she is married and has six children. She says that what she enjoys most about Pro Mujer is holding group meetings.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and potatoes.

loans.name: Mariela Isabel

texts.es: Mariela de 48 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad, área metropolitana de la ciudad de Barranquilla y allí tiene su propio negocio a través del cual vende alimentos, actividad que inició desde hace 14 meses, cuando percibió la necesidad  de comprar comidas rápidas, en la comunidad policías por ser un lugar muy concurrido y allí se instaló  arrendando un carruaje de perros calientes. Hoy sus principales productos son los perros calientes, las hamburguesas, salchipapas, chuzos arepuelas etc. Sus ventas las realiza desde los martes hasta los domingos, desde las 5 de la tarde hasta las 12 de la noche o más tarde si es necesario. Sus compras las realiza en distribuidores de salsamentarías y de contado con una frecuencia diaria. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen, salsas, e insumos para preparar las comidas rápidas y un carruaje de perros, para no continuar pagando el arriendo de estos diariamente. Su inversión credikiva tendrá éxito porque la hace en el marco de la temporada mas comercial del año y con ella logrará tener un carruaje propio sin que pasa..
texts.en:
Mariela is 48 and lives in Soledad, a neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla. Here she started her business, selling prepared food, 14 years ago when she noticed the demand for fast food. Since the area is very busy, she rented a hot dog cart to get started. Today her main items are hot dogs, hamburgers, sausages, fritters, and others. She conducts business Tuesday through Sunday from 5 pm until midnight, or later as necessary. She purchases sauces from distributors in cash every day.

She is applying for a Kiva loan to buy wholesale sauces and supplies to prepare her food and to buy a hot dog cart so that she will not have to pay daily rent. Her loan will be successful because it is the best selling season of the year and she will have her own cart.

loans.use: to buy wholesale sauces and supplies.

loans.name: El Arenal Group

texts.es: El Grupo "El Arenal" esta conformado por siete mujeres muy trabajadoras son mujeres que siempre han vivido en la misma comunidad porque ellas mismas eligieron el nombre del gupo y le pusieron asi porque donde viven hay un lugar donde hay arena que es lo mejor que se puede apreciar. Doña Isabel quien tambien forma parte del grupo paltica que tiene 32 años de edad esta casada con el señor Abranm desde hace 32 años quien trabaja como comerciantes juntos formaron una familia hijos sinembargo ya ninguno depende de ellos, Doña Isabel siempre ha vivido en la comunidad paltica que desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de productos de jarceria inicio su actividad porque desde pequeña ella siempre veia a sus padres y vecinos que vendian en mercados pero tambien porque cuando se caso quiso ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que sus hijas se encintraban estudiando y queria lo mejor para ellas, Doña Isabel esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas mercancia como coladeras, vasos de licuadora, objetos para ollas expres, cucharas, jergas, trapos, Doña Isabel esta muy contenta porque gracias al credito que KIVA y VISION FOUND porque podra comprar todo lo que le hace falta, Doña Isabel platica que siempre han caminado en la calle para ofrecer su mercancia platica que cosidera que no tiene ninguna dificulatad porque todo se le hace formal que quizas no los dejen vendre con tranquilidad, quisas deq ue sus ventas esten bajas entre otras cosas, aunque ella comenta "Me gustaria algun dia llegar a tener un local propio donde pudieramos vender nuestros productos creo que nuestras ganacias aumentarian demasiadas porque los clientes nos ubicarian mucho mejor y venderiamos mas" Todos los integrantes del grupo igualmente tienen sueños es por eso que tambien estan solicitando credito a la institucion como Doña Zenaida invertira en fantasia, Rosa en Vasos de licuadora y jarceria, Veronica en articulos navideños, Gloria en medias y vasos de licuadora, Rosa Ma. en fibras y Jarceria y finalmente Alicia en su Tienda de abarrotes estos son todos los integrantes del grupo.
texts.en: The "El Arenal" (the sandy spot) group is made up of seven very hard-working woman who have always lived in the same community.  The women themselves chose this name for the group because the area where they live has some of the best sand you can ever find.  One member of the group, Isabel, tells us that she is 32 years old and has been married to Abranm, a trader, for 32 years.  Together, they had a family but now their children are independent.  Isabel has always lived in the same community and for 20 years she has been selling household products.  She started this because as a child she always saw her parents and neighbours that would sell at the markets and then, when she married, she wanted to help her husband with the household bills.  Her daughters studied and she wanted the best for them.  Isabel is applying for a loan in order to buy more merchandise, such as strainers, blender cups, items for pressure cookers, spoons, cloths and floor cloths.  Isabel is very happy because, thanks to the loan from Kiva and Vision Found, she will be able to buy everything she needs.  She says that she has always walked the streets to sell her products.  She thinks that she does not have any difficulties because she is reliable in what she does in case they stop her from selling in peace.  Perhaps her sales are low though she says:  "One day I would like to have my own place where we could sell our products.  I think our profits would increase so much because customers would know where to find us much more easily and we would sell more".  All the members of the group also have dreams and so they are all applying for a loan.  Zenaida will use hers to buy novelty items; Rosa will buy blender cups and household products; Veronica will invest in items for Christmas; Gloria will buy socks and blender cups; Rosa Ma will buy fibres and household products; and, finally, Alicia will buy for her grocery store.  These are all the members of the group.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as strainers, blender cups, items for pressure cookers, spoons, cloths and floor cloths.

loans.name: Hermelinda Eva

texts.es:
La señora Hermelinda Eva esta casada, tiene 23 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales 1 esta estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa para mujeres, inicio este negocio realizando ventas en diferentes punto del los mercados cercanos a ella, hasta el momento lleva 2 años experiencia, cuenta con  el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la tejeduría.

Solicita un préstamo que  le servirá para la compra de mercaderías, consistente en cortes, blusas, suéteres, guipiles, fajas, y otros, Las cuales harán que pueda vender mas, espera en el futuro tener varios puestos en diferentes mercados de su región.
texts.en:
Hermelinda Eva is 23 years old and married.  She completed only primary education.  She has two children, one of whom is studying.  Hermelinda sells women's clothing, having started this work by selling at various points in nearby markets.  She now has two years experience and receives support from her husband, who is a weaver.

She is applying for a loan in order to buy merchandise, such as traditional clothing, blouses, sweaters, Indian dresses and belts, among other things.  She will work to sell more of these and hopes to have various stalls in different markets in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La Sra.ñ Rosa María tiene 24 años, es casada, tiene un pequeño niño de un año. Ella es estudiante de la carrera de contabilidad. Paralelamente trabaja en una empresa de transporte como secretaria. Una de sus metas es formar su propio estudio contable. Solicitó el crédito para cubrir la totalidad del pago de sus estudios correspondientes al año 2013. Está muy agradecida con los inversionistas ya que gracias a su apoyo ella logrará poco a poco cumplir con sus metas.
texts.en: Rosa María, 24 years old, is married and has a one year old baby.  She is studying accounting and is working as a secretary in a transport company at the same time.  One of her aims is to have her own accounting firm.  She is applying for this loan to cover her tuition fees for 2013.  She is very grateful to investors for the support and, little by little, she will be able to attain her goals.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees for this year.

loans.name: Las Del Centro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS DEL CENTRO”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Teofila es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso, venta de chuño, venta de fruta y gelatina, costura de polleras, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Teofila es parte integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de promotora de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de queso da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su familia desde niña y ahora que tiene 68 años sigue trabajando en la producción de quesos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de vaca lechera) que adquirirá de las comunidades aledañas, por mayor,  y posteriormente a la crianza lo comercializará a pedido en la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito
texts.en: Las Del Centro Group (the name means "the women from the centre") is starting its first cycle with field partner Pro Mujer, in the framework of the focus centre of Achacachi. It has nine members and an executive board, with Teofila as president. The members of the group are engaged in various activities, among them cheese sales, chuño (a freeze-dried potato product) sales, fruits and jelly sales, dress sewing, and clothing sales. This loan will thus benefit a group of very small entrepreneurs with diverse businesses. Teofila tells us that this is the first time she works with Pro Mujer. She got to know this field partner thanks to its spokesperson, who came to visit her at her house. Teofila is a cheesemonger, a trade she learned from her parents when she was young. Now that she is 68, she still keeps at it and produces cheese. She wants to take out a loan in order to increase her working capital and buy a milk cow in a nearby village, at a very good price. Afterwards, she will be able to sell her cheese in the city of El Alto. The income Teofila derives from her business enables her to help with household expenses, since she is married and has four children. When asked what she likes about working with Pro Mujer, she talks about the training received on topics such as health and credit options.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Nellys Leonor

texts.es: Nellys de 39 años se dedica a la venta de mercancías mediante guías especializadas de productos o catálogos, actividad que inició, desde hace 1 año, con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos pues como madre cabeza de familia ha aumentado la necesidad de responder por el sostenimiento de su hogar, especialmente de su hijo de 20 años de edad.   Sus ventas las realiza a crédito  mientras sus compras las hace de contado. Los principales productos de su oferta son cosméticos, ropa interior y ropa exterior. Su meta es tener un local propio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mercancía variada como cosméticos productos capilares, perfumería y ropa interior. Su inversión de credikiva tendrá éxito porque pide directamente al proveedor, evitando la intermediación y el aumento de los precios al consumidor final
texts.en:
Nellys, 39, has been selling brand specific and other catalog merchandise for the past year to increase her income. As a single mother head of household, she must support her family, in particular her 20-year-old son. She offers sales on credit, though she purchases in cash. Her main items are cosmetics, underwear, and clothing.

Her goal is to have her own store and improve her family's situation. She is applying for a Kiva loan, her first with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy inventory such as cosmetics, hair products, and underwear.  The loan will be successful because she will purchase directly from the manufacturer, thereby avoiding the middleman and higher consumer prices.

loans.use: to buy inventory such as cosmetics, hair products, and underwear.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José Luis, 53 años de edad, Soltero con dos hijos de 19 y 10años  edad, en la actualidad el de 19años no estudia sino que trabaja y la niña de 10 años estudia en 5to grado de primaria, es originario del municipio de Chichigalpa, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. José Luis es un hombre sobresaliente muy trabajador, responsable, tanto para su trabajo como para sus hijos, el presta el servicio de fotografía,  filmación de videos, al igual que edita trabajos para darles una mejor calidad a los clientes, brinda sus servicios en la ciudad de Chichigalpa cuando sedan actividades como casamientos, quinceaños, graduaciones, cumpleaños entre otros, a él siempre le ha gustado la fotografía labor que desempeña desde hace 25 años. El necesita financiamiento para comprar una cámara de toma de videos con mayor capacidad y moderna que las que ya tiene, el cual con esta cámara le permitirá prestar in servicio con más calidad y aún mejor precio y asi dar mejor servicio que sus competidores, uno de sus sueños es poder establecer un estudio de videos y fotografías con la tecnología más moderna posible
texts.en:
Jose Luis, 53 years old, is unmarried with two children, 19 and 10 years old. Currently, the 19-year-old does not study, but instead works, and the 10-year-old girl is in the fifth grade of primary school. He is originally from the town of Chichigalpa, a place that is located in the western zone of the country. Jose Luis is an outstanding man who is very hardworking and responsible, as much in his work as with his children.

He provides photography and video filming services, as well as editing, to give his customers better quality goods. He provides his services in the city of Chichigalpa when activities like weddings, fifteenth birthdays, graduations, and birthdays, among others, occur. He has always enjoyed photography, work that he has performed for 25 years.

He needs financing to buy a video camera with a higher capacity and more modern than the one he already has. This camera will allow him to provide service with higher quality and at an even better price, and therefore be able to provide a better service than his competitors. One of his dreams is to be able to establish a video and photography studio with the most modern technology possible.

loans.use: to buy a higher capacity and better quality video camera.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the ingredients needed to bake bread.

loans.name: Álvaro De Jesús

texts.es:
Álvaro de 54 años de edad dedicó la mayor parte de su vida al oficio de la construcción; debido a la inestabilidad en la contratación, se vio en la necesidad de buscar otra fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Gracias a la sugerencia de un amigo don Álvaro decidió montar una legumbrería móvil, con la cual recorre las calles del municipio de Itagüí en búsqueda de clientes todos los días de nueve de la mañana a 6 de la tarde. 

Su mayor anhelo es poder mejorar su condición económica para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Para cumplir este propósito se encuentra solicitando un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de una carreta de madera para transportar la legumbre y surtido.
texts.en:
Álvaro, 54, has spent most of his life in the construction industry. Given the uncertainty of employment, he found it necessary to find another source of income to support his household. At his friend Alvaro's suggestion, he decided to use a vegetable cart to travel the streets of Itagüí every day, selling to customers from 9 am until 6 pm.

His great wish is to improve his financial situation and offer his family a better life. To achieve this, he is applying for a loan to buy a wood cart to transport his vegetables and other items.

loans.use: to buy a wood cart and vegetables.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz Elena de 32 años de edad, es una mujer que tiene claro que con esfuerzo y disciplina se pueden alcanzar los sueños. Diariamente abre su negocio a las siete de la mañana y comienza su faena. Manifiesta que su negocio lo ha construido con mucho sacrificio y agradece a Dios las bendiciones que diariamente recibe, pues gracias a su trabajo su hija de 11 años, puede asistir a la escuela y disfrutar de su niñez. 
Beatriz es una mujer con una gran visión de empresaria, su mayor deseo es poder posicionar su negocio e incrementas las ventas. Para lograrlo se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía-licor, gaseosa-mecatos- con el propósito de amentar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Beatriz Elena is 32 years old. She firmly believes that efforts and discipline can help her make her dreams become reality. She opens her shop at seven every morning and starts her working day. She tells us of the great sacrifices necessary to set up her business and thanks God for the blessings of each day, since thanks to her business her eleven year-old daughter can go to school and enjoy her childhood. Beatriz has an ambitious business vision, and her greatest wish is to position her shop on the market to increase her sales. To that end, she is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell (alcohol, fizzy drinks, snacks) in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Marcia Del Socorro

texts.es: Marcia Del Socorro 45 años de edad, casada con dos hijos ambos mayores de edad 24 y 20años son independientes, originaria de Chichigalpa, ella es propietaria de un negocio de venta de granos básicos en el mercado central de esta ciudad, las compras las realiza al contado en distribuidoras al por mayor, así también en trilladoras y/o desgranadoras, las ventas las realiza al contado y en temporadas de zafra ella ofrece al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales, ella hace poco adquiere un lugar más para ampliar su negocio, ella nos expresa que gracias al apoyo ha logrado aumentar más su negocio y así ofrecerle mejores productos a  sus clientes. Ella nos está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, azúcar, Maíz, Frijoles, Aceite, Jabón, entre otros.
texts.en:
Marcia Del Socorro is 45 years old. She is married with two adult children, 24 and 20 years old and independent. Originally from Chichigalpa, she is the owner of a business that sells basic grains in the central market of this city. She makes her purchases in cash at distributors in wholesale, and also at threshers and/or hullers. She makes her sales in cash and in the harvest season, she provides her goods in cash and credit to regular and occasional customers. She recently acquired another place to expand her business. 

She tells us that thanks to the support, she has managed to increase her business more and therefore offer better products to her customers. She is requesting funding to buy basic grains, like rice, sugar, corn, beans, and oil, and soap, among others.

loans.use: to invest more in her work capital, and therefore offer a large variety of products to her customers.

loans.name: Douglas Antonio

texts.es: El joven Douglas trabajando siempre en su carpintería en donde labora de lunes a sábado con 3 personas más, quienes le ayudan a avanzar con los encargos de sus clientes que le compran por mayor, está ubicado en uno de los mercados de Managua ahí le facilita la venta ya que es bien concurrido el lugar, esto le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia y en un futuro desea expandir mas su producción y tener su propia línea de crédito, con este cuarto financiamiento desea invertir comprando plywod, madera, espejos, cerraduras para reforzar su especialidad en la elaboración de roperos y cómodas, está muy contento porque con su negocio y el apoyo de los créditos ha podido ir prosperando con su esposa y sus hijos cuyo objetivo es que ellos sean grandes profesionales.
texts.en: Douglas keeps working as a carpenter Mondays to Saturdays. He has three people who help him fulfil his clients' wholesale orders. He has a stall at one of the markets of Managua, which is very beneficial to his sales, since it is very frequented. This helped him improve his family's quality of life. In the future, he hopes to produce more furniture and have his own credit line. With this fourth loan, he will buy plywood, wood, mirrors, and padlocks, in order to make the type of furniture he specialises in, namely wardrobes and chests of drawers. He is very happy with his current situation, since, thanks to his business and to the help he received with the loans, his spouse and children have been doing increasingly well. He hopes his children will become talented professionals.

loans.use: to buy the materials necessary to make furniture.

loans.name: Las Alpaquitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALPAQUITAS”  iniciará segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Magari es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: confección de enaguas, venta de vestidos, confección de polleras, tienda de barrio, confección de mantas, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Magari es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que le fue a visitar a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de polleras que emprendió en una institución técnica posteriormente decide abrir su propia microempresa.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en la frontera de Bolivia y Perú. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos económicos para su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en: Alpaquitas Group is starting its second cycle with field partner Pro Mujer, in the framework of the focus centre of Panamericana. It comprises eight members and has an executive board, with Magari as president. The members of the group are engaged in various activities, among them lace weaving, dress sales, dressmaking, grocery shop, plaid weaving, vegetable sales. This loan will thus benefit a group of very small entrepreneurs. Magari tells us that she has been working with Pro Mujer for one year. She got to know this field partner thanks to a spokesperson who came to visit her at her house. Magari makes and sells skirts. She learned at a school and then decided to start her own small business. She wants to take out a loan in order to increase her working capital and buy cloth at the markets of the town of El Alto, at a very good price. Afterwards, she will be able to sell her wares near the border between Bolivia and Peru. The income Magari derives from her business enables her to help with household expenses, since she is married and has two children. When asked what she likes about working with Pro Mujer, she talks about the training received on topics such as health and credit options.

loans.use: to buy cloth.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Reyna Isabel habita en el caserío Los Limones ubicado a 3 km del Sauce, una comarca rural donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la actividad ganadera por la ventaja de la característica de la zona que abunda el pasto para la buena alimentación del ganado.
Esta señora heredó esta vocación de ser ganadera de su padre el cual le inculcó el amor al campo y a los animales.
Hoy en día trabaja en conjunto con su esposo y sus hijos en la crianza de terneros para su posterior venta y la comercialización de leche la cual la vende a acopiadores que se encargan de exportarla por la buena calidad de la misma.
Cuenta con su humilde finca y su hato ganadero que ha ido creciendo por el esfuerzo propio de su familia.
Necesita un crédito para la compra de cuatro terneros para engordarlos y luego venderlos y de esta pequeña ganancia que obtiene sustenta a su familia.

Confía en Dios que Kiva y Ceprodel aprueben su solicitud para llevar a cabo su inversión y así generar ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel lives in a community called Los Limones, located 3 kilometers from Sauce, a rural region where the majority of its inhabitants work in cattle breeding. The region has an advantageous characteristic: its abundant pasture for feeding livestock.

This woman was taught the profession of being a livestock breeder by her father, who instilled in her a love for the country and animals.  Now, she works with her husband and her sons in raising calves for their future sale, and sells milk to workers who take charge of exporting it because of its high quality.

She counts on her humble farm and her herd of livestock that has grown due to her family's efforts.  She needs a loan to buy four calves to fatten them and later sell them, and sustain her family from this small profit.

She trusts in God that Kiva and Ceprodel will approve the request to carry out her investment and generate income for her family.

loans.use: to buy four calves

loans.name: Anielka Karina

texts.es:
La joven Anielka Karina es originaria de la calle real donde nació y creció, es una joven emprendedora, soltera que gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres se preparó como Lic. en Lengua y Literatura ya que le apasiona la lectura y es lo que les transmite a sus alumnos a los cuales les imparte clases.

Labora como maestra de secundaria en la comarca las Mojarras donde a diario se levanta a las 4 am para poder estar puntual en su centro de trabajo donde viaja en autobús recorriendo 60 km.
Como responsable de la estabilidad y bienestar de sus padres desea darles mejores condiciones de vida ya que ellos dependen de ella, por tal razón está solicitando un crédito para mejora de vivienda con el cual comprará ladrillos y cemento para ampliar un cuarto con el fin de tener más espacio en la vivienda.
Por los bajos salarios que se gana en nuestro país muchas veces no se pueden cumplir los sueños pero con la buena voluntad y misericordia de los inversionistas  kiva mejoran el nivel de vida y económico de las personas a través de estos préstamos por ese motivo espera le concedan esta solicitud para poco a poco ir cumpliendo sus sueños.
texts.en:
The young woman, Anielka Karina, still lives on the same street where she was born and grew up. She is a young, single entrepreneur who, thanks to the effort of her parents, trained in language and literature since she loves reading. That is transmitted to the students she teaches.

She works as a high school teacher in the Mojarras region where she rises at 4am daily and travels 60km by bus in order to be punctual at her workplace.

She is responsible for the stability and well-being of her parents and wants to give them better living conditions, since they depend on her. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to improve their home by buying bricks and cement to expand a room to have more living space.

Because of the low salaries earned in her country, many times people are unable to fulfill their dreams. But, with the goodwill and compassion of the Kiva lenders, they can improve their standard of living and the economy of the people through these loans. For that reason, she hopes they will grant her this request to gradually fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement.

loans.name: Manuela Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Manuela Magdalena esa casada, tienen  34años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 están estudiando, se dedica a comercio a la venta de ropa de mujeres, inicio este negocio tendiendo un poco de capital y hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es transportista.

Solicita un préstamo que solicita para la compra de mercadería para la venta, espera comprar mas venta, consistente en blusas, cortes, delantales, guipiles, etc. Esto con el fin que tenga mejores oportunidades de vender, y poder mas adelante tener otros puntos de venta. Así podrá darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Manuela Magdalena is 34 years old, married, and has completed six years of primary education. She has four children, two of whom are studying. Manuela sells women’s clothing, and she started her business with just a little capital. She has six years of experience so far, with the support of her husband who is a shipper. 

Manuela is asking for a loan to purchase merchandise to sell like blouses, skirts, aprons, and traditional clothing, etc., so that she can have better opportunities to sell, and later on be able to have other sales outlets. In this way, she will be able to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: El Futuro Del Mañana Group

texts.es: Este es el Grupo “El Futuro del Mañana” que  conforman 05 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio que pasan al ciclo 05. Eduardo tiene 30 años, soltero. Eduardo se dedica desde hace 06 años a la venta de comida, cuenta con clientes fidelizados. El sueño de Eduardo es ampliar más su negocio para así poder atender mejor a sus clientes. El crédito que solicito lo destinara para la compra de arroz, aceite, papa, pollo. Eduardo está muy contento con este préstamo y agradece a los inversionistas Kiva. Eduardo se encuentra en la parte de atrás es el tercero del lado derecho, viste polo plomo y jean.
texts.en: This is the Future of Tomorrow Group which has five members that are involved in a variety of businesses. They are in their 5th cycle of borrowing. Eduardo is single and 30 years old. He has been selling food for 6 years, and has a loyal customer base. Eduardo’s dream is to grow his business so that he will be able to serve his customers better. The loan he asks for will be used to buy rice, cooking oil, potatoes and chicken. Eduardo is very happy with this loan and thankful to KIVA’s investors. He is the third from the right dressed in jeans and a gray shirt.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, potatoes, and chicken.

loans.name: Cándida Paula

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León al occidente de Nicaragua habita la Sra. Cándida Paula, una señora de 42 años que ha vivido toda su vida en dicha ciudad, se desempeña como maestra de primaria donde tiene 19 años de laborar y que por la necesidad de contar con un empleo y tener el sustento para su hogar tuvo que trasladarse hasta la comarca las Mojarras la cual queda a uno 90 km de su ciudad natal.
En ese humilde caserío imparte clases de primaria a niños de escasos recursos los cuales muchas veces no tienen para comprar un par de zapatos y tienen que asistir así al colegio pero con la voluntad de querer aprender a leer y escribir.

Esta señora con mucha dedicación desempeña su labor porque considera el gran esfuerzo que estos niños bajo su pobreza asisten a la escuela, el mismo esfuerzo que tiene por sacar a delante a su único hijo en cual estudia una carrera universitaria y que le cuesta solamente a ella porque no tiene el apoyo del padre.
Con gran sacrificio ha mejorado poco a poco su vivienda y en este momento está necesitando un crédito y el apoyo incondicional de Ceprodel a través de los inversionistas Kiva para ponerle cerámica a su casa con el cual comprara cerámica, cemento y pago de mano de obra. Con mucha fé espera este poyo.
texts.en:
In the city of León in western Nicaragua lives Cándida Paula, a 42 year old woman who has lived her entire life in this city. She works as a teacher at a primary school where she has been for 19 years. 

Due to the necessity of counting on a job and having a livelihood for her household, she had to move to the district of Mojarras, which is located 90 kilometers from her hometown. In this humble village, she teaches primary classes to underprivileged children, who often aren’t able to purchase a pair of shoes and have to go to school like that – but always with the will to learn to read and write. 

This woman carries out her work with much dedication, because she has in mind the great effort with which these children, under their poverty, attend school. This is the same effort that she puts toward getting her only child ahead, who is studying for a professional career; the cost is upon her alone, because she doesn’t have support from the father.  

With a lot of sacrifice, she has improved her home little by little, and at this time she needs a loan and the unconditional support of Ceprodel through the Kiva lenders, which she will use to buy tiles, cement, and to pay for labor. With a great deal of faith, she hopes for this support.

loans.use: to purchase tiles, cement, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Jaqueline María

texts.es:
La joven Jaqueline María es originaria de la comarca Los Zarzales pero desde hace un año se trasladó a vivir a la comarca las Mojarras por las circunstancias de la vida y por adquirir experiencia como maestra de primaria impartiendo clases en el colegio de dicha comunidad.
Es una joven emprendedora que estudió la carrera de Magisterio y a pesar de su corta edad, que por su buena conducta la ascendieron a directora de dicho centro.
Hoy en día ya terminó la carrera pero necesita tramitar su título universitario para tener un mejor nivel social y por ende un mejor nivel económico porque aumenta su salario lo cual es muy costoso por lo que necesita un crédito para llevar a cabo dicho trámite.
Confía en Dios y pide el apoyo a Kiva a través de Ceprodel para que le faciliten este crédito ya que sin ello no puede cumplir su sueño de tener su título ya que actualmente gana muy poco.
texts.en:
The young Jaqueline María is from the region of Los Zarzales, but a year ago she moved to the region of Mojarras due to her personal life circumstances and also to gain experience as an elementary school teacher in said region. She is a young entrepreneur who has studied a career in education and despite her young age, because of her good behavior, she has become the director of the previously mentioned school. 

She has finished her studies, but she still needs to submit the paperwork necessary to receive her university degree itself, which is a very expensive process. She would use the loan to pay for this expensive process, which will help her improve her social standing and thus enter a higher economic level because receiving her degree will increase her salary. 

She confides in God and asks for Kiva's help through CEPRODEL to give her a loan, since without it she will not be able to achieve her dream of obtaining her university degree and increase her very modest salary.
